title: Hadashi no Gen
mu_alt_titles: Barefoot Gen: A Cartoon Story of Hiroshima
เก็น เจ้าหนูสู้ชีวิต (มติชน)
mu_description: Barefoot Gen recounts the bombing of Hiroshima from the perspective of a young boy, Gen, and his family. But the book's themes (the physical and psychological damage ordinary people suffer from war's realities) ring chillingly true today. Gen and his family have long been struggling without much food, money or medicine, but despite hardships, they try to maintain a semblance of normal life. The adults are exhausted and near despair; the children take air raids and starvation more or less in stride. Nakazawa, a Hiroshima survivor, effectively portrays the strain of living in this environment and shows how efforts to stay upbeat in dire circumstances sometimes manifest as manic, irrational humor. The story offers some optimism: characters perform acts of self-sacrifice for the sake of neighbors and loved ones (e.g., when Gen's pregnant mother becomes ill from malnutrition, he and his brother pose as orphans and perform in the streets, throwing the money over the walls of their home so they won't get caught). Underneath this can-do attitude are the parents' deep guilt and sense of helplessness. When the children clamor ecstatically over a scrap of food, the parents dissolve in shame and grief. The art is sharply drawn and expressive, and the narrative has such a natural rhythm, it's easy to get pulled into the family's life, making the cataclysm readers know awaits them all the more real, intimate and difficult to take. Despite its harrowing nature, this work is invaluable for the lessons it offers in history, humanity and compassion.
trivia: Hadashi no Gen is based on the author Keiji Nakazawa's own experiences as a Hiroshima survivor.
Hadashi no Gen depicts the physical and psychological damage ordinary people suffer from war.
Hadashi no Gen portrays the challenges of maintaining normalcy amidst starvation and air raids in pre-bombing Hiroshima.

title: Play Ball
mu_description:
After fracturing a finger in a junior high school game, Takao Taniguchi is unable to play baseball. After entering Sumitani High School, he is constantly watching the baseball club even though he is unable to play. He catches the eye of the captain of the soccer club, and while he still has lingering hopes of joining the baseball club, he decides to join the soccer club. While he's a complete beginner, Taniguchi developed a strong spirit of hard work while in junior high school and his new teammates begin to see his potential. While he focuses all of his energy on soccer, he is unable to forget his youthful zeal for baseball and he begins umpiring baseball games in secret.

The series was released concurrently with Chiba's other major work, [Captain](http://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=14852), the other series for which he won the 22nd Shogakukan Manga Award for shounen in 1977.

Source: Wikipedia
trivia: Play Ball focuses on Takao Taniguchi who switches from baseball to soccer after a finger injury.
Play Ball was released at the same time as the author's other work, 'Captain'.

mu_description:

When the beautiful, intelligent, immensly rich and seemingly perfect zaibatsu heiress Shizuka Ayakouji transfers from Tokyo into Rei's rural school, the differences between them immediately causes them to clash, and before long their rivalry ends up involving their entire school. Will the two girls ever be able to see eye to eye, or are they destined to stay on bad terms?

Also includes the one-shot Mikeneko Rock.

mu_description:
The typical Kochikame plot involves Ryo-san coming up with a money-making scheme by inventing a new gadget or capitalizing on a fad, achieving great success, calling on Nakagawa's help as things turn sour, and finally losing it all as the fad runs out of steam or out of control. While the plots are gag-driven, much of the humor comes from the juxtaposition of mundane characters with the bizarrely incongruous (Nakagawa's wealth, Maria's appeal, everyone's lack of actual police work), most of which is never explained or rationalized in the slightest.

Note: Won the Seiun Award for Best Comic in 2017.
trivia: Kochikame humor derives from the contrast between ordinary characters and their outlandish circumstances.

title: Shaka no Musuko
mu_description:
Who is he? Where did he come from? What did he come to do?

A man bearing the moniker "the Son of Shaka" comes by the peaceful, quiet Shogidani Village. Followed by a trio of triplet sisters, his agenda is unknown, but he quickly gains a good reputation within the village...

He doesn't matter much to the village boy Tomeo, though, who is threatened with separation with his girlfriend, Seiko, and ever-persistent advances by the pesky Aoki.  
That is, until Seiko starts to feel swayed by the Son of Shaka's aid, his 'hand of love'. Tomeo's concern isn't just petty jealousy, though - the Son of Shaka's intent points to a certain direction....

George Akiyama (Ashura, Money Crazy ) presents a chaotic thriller of a close-knit village being stricken with corruption, calamity, and absolute evil.
trivia: Shaka no Musuko is a manga series created by George Akiyama, known for other works like Ashura and Money Crazy.

mu_description: On her death bed, Kousaku Sakamoto's mother tells him that after she dies, he should go to Tokyo where he'll be taken care of by her friend Ibari Oozora and his family. Since his father died three years before and with no where else to go, Kousaku decides to go along with his mother's last request. However, he soon discovers that Ibari is the boss of the Oozora Group mob ring. Uneasy about his predicament, he considers leaving, but he has second thoughts when he meets Ibari's four daughters–Tsugumi, Tsubame, Suzume and Hibari–only to find out that Hibari is actually Ibari's only son. Now Kousaku must not only cope with living among mobsters but also with refusing Hibari's advances toward him.

Jingi Kikukawa is a guy who during his 13 years of life was never defeated by anyone, a year ago he was transferred to the school of Touun, each school is protected by a leader of warriors provided art lovers quarrels, after an appointment with Yasuoka (Tooun leader), Jingi is victorious, made him become the new leader of the school, however, will soon meet his nemesis, Sho Takeshima, head of a gang that controls the western Japan, who will teach a good lesson in the fight.

trivia: Otokozaka centers around Jingi Kikukawa, a protagonist undefeated in his first 13 years.
Otokozaka features rivalries between school leaders and gang heads.

title: Baoh Raihōsha
mu_description:
An innocent young man, Ikuroo, has a parasite known as Baoh implanted in his brain by an evil organization, Doress. The parasite makes him nearly immortal and gives him the ability to transform into a really powerful beastie when he's in trouble.   
Doress intends to use him in some sort of ploy for world domination. But while they're moving him around, a young psychic girl, Sumire (who's also being held by the organization), sets him free, and the two escape together. Of course, Dr. Kasuminome is the mad scientist behind the whole thing, and he isn't about to let his test subject get away... and he has everything from superpowered lackeys to a small army at his disposal.
trivia: Baoh Raihōsha features Dr. Kasuminome as the main antagonist, leading the organization Doress.
Baoh Raihōsha involves a psychic girl named Sumire who helps Ikuroo escape.

title: Tsuide ni Tonchinkan
mu_alt_titles: ついでにとんちんかん
mu_description: A gag manga series by Koichi Endo which first appeared in Weekly Shōnen Jump in issues 49–50 in 1984, and then ran from 1985 (issue 14) through 1989 (issue 22). There are 18 volumes of the manga.
trivia: Tsuide ni Tonchinkan initially appeared as a two-issue run in Weekly Shōnen Jump issues 49-50 in 1984 before becoming a regular series.
Tsuide ni Tonchinkan ran for four years in Weekly Shōnen Jump, from 1985 to 1989.
Tsuide ni Tonchinkan comprises a total of 18 collected manga volumes.

title: Dragon Ball
mu_alt_titles: ดราก้อนบอล
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Before there was Dragon Ball Z, there was Akira Toriyama's action epic Dragon Ball, starring the younger version of Son Goku and all the other Dragon Ball Z heroes! Meet a naive young monkey-tailed boy named Goku, whose quiet life changes when he meets Bulma, a girl who is on a quest to collect seven "Dragon Balls." If she gathers them all, an incredibly powerful dragon will appear and grant her one wish. But the precious orbs are scattered all over the world, and Bulma needs Goku's help (and his super-strength)! With a magic staff for a weapon and a flying cloud for a ride, Goku sets out on the adventure of a lifetime.

[Read for FREE on Manga Plus](https://mangaplus.shueisha.co.jp/titles/100011)
trivia: Dragon Ball initially focused on adventure and exploration before transitioning into primarily martial arts combat.
Dragon Ball features Goku, a monkey-tailed boy, as its main protagonist.

title: Sakigake!! Otokojuku
mu_alt_titles: โรงเรียนลูกผู้ชาย (SIC)
mu_description:
Otokojuku - a private school for juvenile delinquents that were previously expelled from normal schools. At this school, Japanese chivalry is taught through feudal and military fundamentals. Similar to an action film, the classes are overwhelmed by violence. Only those who survive it become true men.

from Renta!
trivia: Sakigake!! Otokojuku utilizes extreme violence as a core element of its training regime, distinguishing it from typical school settings.
Sakigake!! Otokojuku centers around teaching Japanese chivalry to juvenile delinquents.
Sakigake!! Otokojuku features feudal and military fundamentals as key components of its curriculum.

title: Black Knight Bat
mu_alt_titles: ブラックナイトバット
mu_description: Bat has returned to her birthplace, Rainbowria, where her mother grew up. The 17-year-old Bat, as the princess of the Black Knight Queen, has roused the sealed Starship from its sleep. The story follows Bat's adventures in the mysterious Starship.

title: Love & Fire
mu_description:
Is Honoo the son of a legendary boxer? Does he have what it takes to live up to the legacy of his blood?! 

From Manga Reborn
trivia: Love & Fire focuses on the theme of living up to a family legacy.
Love & Fire was published by Manga Reborn.

title: Saint Seiya
mu_alt_titles: Saint Seiya: Knights of the Zodiac
เซนต์เซย์ย่า
mu_description:
From Viz:  
In Greek mythology, Athena, the daughter of Zeus, was born in full armor. By birthright the goddess of battle, she did not believe in conquest, and only fought defensive wars. Her battles with bloodthirsty gods and giants shook the very earth and seemed to last forever. On the battlefield, there were a group of youths that always surrounded and protected the goddess: the Knights of Athena! Flash forward to modern-day Greece: two Japanese tourists are shocked to see a mansized meteorite crash to the earth before them. It turns out to be young Seiya. Seiya must train harder than ever if he is to survive his match with the brutal Cassios. Whoever wins will receive the greatest prize known to man: the incredibly powerful Pegasus Cloth.
trivia: Saint Seiya features characters called Knights of Athena who protect the goddess.
Saint Seiya is set in modern-day Greece and based on Greek mythology.

title: Metal K
mu_description:
From Yomoyo:  
After enduring the brutal murder of her parents and being subjected to a horrific act of being burned alive, Keiko emerges several years later as a cyborg! Fueled by a thirst for revenge, she embarks on a relentless pursuit of those responsible.

The 1998 print included the one-shot *Katasumi no Hito*.

[Official English](https://yomoyo.net/product/184048)
trivia: Metal K is a manga series about Keiko, a cyborg seeking revenge.
Metal K includes a one-shot manga titled *Katasumi no Hito* in its 1998 print.

title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
mu_alt_titles: ジョジョの奇妙な冒険
mu_description:
An epic supernatural-horror-action-adventure spanning generations of the Joestar family, each arc of *Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken* focuses on a different descendent and their battles with various super-powered opponents.

1: *[Phantom Blood](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=65532796324)* - Jonathan Joestar

2: *[Battle Tendency](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=54897639880)* - Joseph Joestar

3: *[Stardust Crusaders](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=60420553585)* - Kujou Joutarou

4: *[Diamond wa Kudakenai](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=42553317740)* (Diamond Is Unbreakable) - Higashikata Jousuke

5: *[Vento Aureo](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=63711986459)* - Giorno Giovana (Major antagonist Dio Brando's son)

6: *[Stone Ocean](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=2655353745)* - Jolyne Kujou

7: *[Steel Ball Run](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=4507270726)* (AU of *Phantom Blood*) - Johnny Joestar (alternate universe Jonathan Joestar) & Gyro Zeppeli (alternate version)

8: *[JoJolion](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=49100542773)* (AU of *Diamond wa Kudakenai*) - Higashikata Jousuke (alternate version) & Hirose Yasuho (alternate universe Hirose Kouichi)

9: *[The JOJOLands](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=39475021878)*
trivia: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure features protagonists who are all related, each belonging to a different generation of the Joestar family.
JoJo's Bizarre Adventure is divided into distinct parts, each focusing on a different Joestar descendant and their individual story arc.
JoJo's Bizarre Adventure Part 5, *Vento Aureo*, features Giorno Giovanna, the son of the series' major antagonist Dio Brando.

title: God Sider
mu_description: In ancient times, Satan was defeated by the gods in the War of Armageddon and was sealed away deep within the earth. But in the modern day, Satan once again aims to control all the universe - and towards this aim, his Devil Siders have begun to act! But now the child born between the worlds of gods and demons, Reiki Kikoku, has joined forces with the God Siders to destroy the demons!!
trivia: God Sider features a conflict between the God Siders and the Devil Siders.

title: Present from Lemon
mu_alt_titles: プレゼントフロムレモン
mu_description:
From the Animeraider:

Here’s a manga from more than two decades ago by the creator of Video Girl Ai, I’s, and Zetman about a young man who took over as a singer after the sudden death of his father during a show, and the idol singer who was there when it happened…
trivia: Present from Lemon was created by Masakazu Katsura, known for later works like Video Girl Ai and I's.
Present from Lemon focuses on a young man who becomes a singer and an idol singer.
Present from Lemon predates Katsura's better known works, having been published over two decades prior to the description being written.

title: The Momotaroh
mu_description: Momotaro is a masked wrestler and a descendant of his legendary warrior namesake. Combining the ferocity of pro wrestling with lighthearted gags, this manga knows how to make the wrestling ring exciting. Throw in characters based on famous figures from fables such as Kintaro and Urashima, and you have yourself a recipe for white-knuckle showdown! (Weekly Shonen Jump Exhibition Vol.1 Catalog)
trivia: The Momotaroh features characters based on famous figures from Japanese fables.
The Momotaroh blends the ferocity of professional wrestling with lighthearted gag humor.

A collection of oneshots which were published in Shuukan Shonen Jump.

-Mysterious Kid   
-SYNCHRONICITY   
-JUMPIN'JACK FLASH  
-Bachi-Atari Rock 

The premises of the last three titles would lead to the creation of [Rokudenashi Blues](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=1134).

title: Bastard!!
mu_alt_titles: BASTARD!! อสูรร้าย จอมราชัน (SIC)
バスタード!! 暗黒の破壊神
mu_description:
From Viz:  
In a post-apocalyptic world of heavy metal fantasy, the only thing able to save humans from orcs, lizard men, and other monsters is something even MORE evil. Sealed within a 14-year-old boy, the chaotic wizard Dark Schneider is unleashed to fight four mighty generals and their plot to resurrect the evil god Anthrasax.

Kazushi Hagiwara published numerous complementary dōjinshi for the series, [most being hentai](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=151931). Vol 1 & 2 of the Complete Edition feature redrawn art (mostly in Vol 2), additional scenes and two graphic sex scenes.
trivia: Bastard!! features a chaotic wizard named Dark Schneider sealed within a 14-year-old boy.
Bastard!! takes place in a post-apocalyptic world of heavy metal fantasy.

title: Kami-sama wa Southpaw
mu_description: Dan Hayasaka was raised in an American monastery. But upon returning home to Japan, he decides to achieve his father's dream of becoming the world champion in boxing. His left fist is imbued with divine power, unleashing one secret technique after another - and leaving fans clamoring for more. (Weekly Shonen Jump Exhibition Vol.1 Catalog)

title: Rokudenashi Blues
mu_alt_titles: จอมเกบลูส์ (SIC)
mu_description:
Maeda is a new student in the Teiken High School. He stutters when he's nervous and he's rather clumsy. He gets noted immediately because he hits a teacher during the entrance ceremony. Some clubs search to enlist him as they see in him a force they can use to get even with other clubs. But Maeda is a loner and has only one dream: becoming boxing champion. His first objective is to beat the leader of the boxing club. "Rokudenashi" translates as "good for nothing".  
The manga focuses more on gang warfare than boxing.
trivia: Rokudenashi Blues translates to "good for nothing," reflecting the main character's initial perceived worth.
Rokudenashi Blues features a protagonist, Maeda, whose primary ambition is to become a boxing champion.

title: Matte! Sailor Fuku Knight
mu_alt_titles: 舞って!セーラー服騎士

title: Cyborg Jiichan G
mu_description:
His name is Tokijirou Kaizou, a brilliant scientist who has decided to spend his waning years taking things much easier: caring for his family, farming on his own plot of land... and transforming himself into a 2000-horsepower cyborg!?

Often makes a cameo appearance in the artist's various works including Hikaru no Go.
trivia: Cyborg Jiichan G features a protagonist who is both a scientist and a cyborg.
Cyborg Jiichan G stars Tokijirou Kaizou, who is a farmer.

title: Cyber Blue
mu_alt_titles: ไซเบอร์บลู (SIC)
mu_description: Tinos is the farthest colony planet from Earth. There lives a generation of people who have corrupted the dreams of the founders from 300 years ago. However, a new man will change it all...

title: Chameleon Jail
mu_description:
"Risk hunters" are professionals who handle jobs considered too tough for normal law enforcement, such as kidnappings, combating terrorism, and preventing murders. One man who stands above them all however is the legendary Chameleon Jail, who has the ability to manipulate his "kara" or internal human body energy in order to physically change his appearance into that of any other person.   
Throughout the series, he pursues several assignments on behalf of various clients given to him by Shall, a woman who runs a detective agency in New York City. All difficult, the successful completion of these assignments hinges on Jail's ability to change his appearance when the time is right.
trivia: Chameleon Jail follows a risk hunter operating outside normal law enforcement.
Chameleon Jail takes place in New York City, where Shall runs a detective agency.

title: The Green Eyes
mu_alt_titles: ザ・グリーン・アイズ
mu_description: A plane crashes in the Amazon. on board are the boss of the Ranmyo Company with his wife and child, Hiroki. Then 18 years later a search party led by Hiroki's grandfather in the Amazon finds his daughter and her husband have changed... as well as Hiroki who's become a warrior for revenge?!

title: Hana no Keiji
mu_alt_titles: Hana no Keiji -Kumo no Kanata ni-
The Magnificient Bastard: The Legend of Keiji
บุรุษเจ้าสำราญ (Pirate)
เคย์จิบุรุษอหังการ (Pirate)
花の慶次 -雲のかなたに-
mu_description:
From Mobots:

During the closing years of the civil war period and uneasy reign of Toyotomi Hideyoshi, when men high and low scramble to follow conventional propriety so that they don't attract undue notice (or death) to themselves, there is one very bizarre individual who is known for his legendarily outlandish and wild personality, physical appearance and behavior. This series traces the dramatic adventures of Maeda Keiji from personal conflicts with his adopted Maeda family, brave combat exploits, travels to the capital, and relationships with famous existing figures such as Tokugawa Iyeyasu, Rikyuu the tea master, and Hideyoshi himself, to experiences with the foreign and Japanese Christian faithful.
trivia: Hana no Keiji is set during the closing years of Japan's civil war period and the reign of Toyotomi Hideyoshi.
Hana no Keiji features historical figures like Tokugawa Iyeyasu and Rikyuu the tea master.
Hana no Keiji depicts Maeda Keiji's unconventional personality as a counterpoint to the conformity of the era.

title: Fushigi Hunter
mu_description: Raimon Ryuuta and Kuuko are sibling. Their parent is a treasure hunter, so since they were little they lives in a shrine with their parent's best friend who is an old man. Ryuuta and Kuuko are interested in anything strange, curious issues. Together they set up their business as a Fushigi Hunter, to solve cases of strange paranormal activity people asking them for help.

title: Slam Dunk
mu_alt_titles: スラムダンク あれから10日後ー
mu_description:
From VIZ:  
Winning isn't everything in the game of basketball, but who wants to come in second? It takes dedication and discipline to be the best, and the Shohoku High hoops team wants to be just that. They have one last year to make their captain's dream of reaching the finals come true--will they do it? Takehiko Inoue's legendary beloved basketball manga is finally here and the tale of a lifetime is in your hands.  
Hanamichi Sakuragi's got no game with girls—none at all! It doesn't help that he's known for throwing down at a moment's notice and always coming out on top. A hopeless bruiser, he's been rejected by 50 girls in a row! All that changes when he meets the girl of his dreams, Haruko, and she's actually not afraid of him! When she introduces him to the game of basketball, his life is changed forever.

To commemorate the 100 Million sales of the series, a one-shot called “10 Days After” was drawn by the author in a classroom at Kanagawa Prefectural Misaki High School in December 2004. This epilogue later published in a special documentary book and Switch magazine in 2005.

Notes: Received the 40th Shogakukan Manga Award for shounen in 1995.
trivia: Slam Dunk won the 40th Shogakukan Manga Award for shonen in 1995.
Slam Dunk commemorated 100 million sales with a one-shot epilogue drawn in a classroom.
Slam Dunk follows Hanamichi Sakuragi, a bruiser who joins the basketball team to impress a girl.

title: Baramon no Kazoku

Three thousand years ago, a sect of ancient Indian priests who sought world peace and justice, developed an unimaginable fist and sent their disciples throughout the world. Their mission, passed on to their descendants, was to live in the shadows of history and judge the evils of this world where the law cannot judge! They are the Family of Brahman!
trivia: Baramon no Kazoku features descendants who act as judges of evil where the law fails.
Baramon no Kazoku involves a fist technique developed 3000 years ago seeking world peace.

title: Change Up!!
mu_description:
From [Unexpected Fate](http://www.mangaupdates.com/groups.html?id=1511):

Tohma Nagasu joins the baseball club to check out girls, but an injury caused him to lose his force when throwing. Only Kaede, the club manager, expects him to heal. Tohma trains hard for Kaede so that he can beat their rival school Shohei, because Kaede's dream is to get to Koshien and Tohma's is to help her out.
trivia: Change Up!! features a plot point revolving around the female baseball club manager, Kaede, and her dream of reaching Koshien.

title: Hareluya
mu_description: It is the manga Umezawa made before his very succesful follow-up BOY and which tells of the adventures of Hibino, delinquent son of God. God gets enough of his son's behaviour and sends him down to earth to better his life and test him. The outcome of this will determine the future of the world, because God won't have his son succeeding him if he doesn't better his life and will end humanity if Hibino fails.
trivia: Hareluya was created by the same author who later achieved great success with the manga series 'BOY'.
Hareluya features Hibino, the delinquent son of God, as its protagonist.

title: BØY

From [Eternal Blue](https://www.mangaupdates.com/groups.html?id=156):  
Basically, this manga follows Hibino Hareluya as he tries to "conquer the world" by dealing with the everyday punks on the street. Always ready to fight and always winning his fights, he just finds himself in more and more trouble. Along the way he surrounds himself with friends who are all very strong in their own unique way.
trivia: BØY follows Hibino Hareluya's journey to "conquer the world" by fighting street punks.
BØY features a main character who surrounds himself with strong and unique friends.

WOMAN IN THE MAN -男の中の女-

title: Tottemo! Luckyman
mu_alt_titles: Lucky Man จริงๆนะจะบอกให้
とっても! ラッキーマン
mu_description: Yoichi Tsuitenai was the unluckiest boy in his hometown. Until one day, his luck truly ran out when he was crushed by an alien spaceship, killing him. But, in this time of need, he was discovered by the great hero of the cosmos Luckyman, who fused with him giving him the power to turn into the universe's luckiest superhero. But now Yoichi, as Luckyman, must defend the Earth from aliens invading to conquer it.
trivia: Tottemo! Luckyman 's protagonist, Yoichi Tsuitenai, gains his powers by fusing with an alien superhero.

title: Ninku
mu_alt_titles: 忍空 セカンドステージ
忍空 ファーストステージ
mu_description:
The story is about an odd-looking 12-year-old boy named Fuusuke, who is a powerful warrior from the Ninku school of martial arts, a style that mixes ninjutsu and karate.

It is explained that before the present time in the story that those who could use Ninku were targeted by an evil empire and the Ninku corps were formed to combat the menace. When the war was over, the Ninku were defeated and almost all of them were killed since they were useless and were also dangerous for the rulers. At the beginning of the story, three years later, Fuusuke, the young former captain of the 1st Ninku corps and controller of the wind and Hiroyuki, his flatulent penguin, start searching for the other Ninku captains, each of whom can control various elements. However, a new group of Ninku users has arisen and are trying to take over the world. Fuusuke and his penguin must defeat the new Ninku empire with the help of his old comrades.

Source: Wikipedia
trivia: Ninku follows Fuusuke, a 12-year-old former captain of the 1st Ninku corps.
Ninku warriors control various elements, with Fuusuke controlling the wind.
Ninku were targeted and almost wiped out after a war, deemed useless and dangerous by the new rulers.

mu_alt_titles: ブラッディ・ソルジャー

title: Komorebi no Moto de...
mu_alt_titles: ใต้ร่มเงาแห่งรัก
mu_description: Tending to his sister, who is paralyzed after a fall from a tree, Tatsuya Kitazaki wants revenge. Yet, just as he is about to cut down the tree, a strange and seemingly ageless girl, Sara Nishikujo, appears to stop him. What's more, the girl seems to have the ability to communicate with plants - and she tells Tatsuya the tree's version of his sister's accident. This marks a watershed in Tatsuya's life, as everything begins to change.

title: DNA²
mu_alt_titles: DNA ผ่าพันธุกรรมข้ามศตวรรษ (Pirate New Project)
何処かで失くしたあいつのアイツ
Ｄ・Ｎ・Ａ² ~他身上 的另一個他~
Ｄ・Ｎ・Ａ＾２ ～何処かで失くしたあいつのアイツ～
mu_description: Japan in the future has a massive over-population problem. Scientists have traced the root of this problem to one particular individual, Junta Monamari. According to their records, Junta was a "Mega-Playboy" who had sired children with over a hundred women. Each one of his sons had inherited the Mega-Playboy gene too, so the problem grew exponentially from thereon. Enter Karin Aoi, a "DNA Operator". Karin is sent back to the past with a mission: to alter Junta's DNA and prevent him from ever becoming the Mega-Playboy, thereby eliminating the world's overpopulation problem. Junta's DNA can only be altered by shooting him with a special bullet called DCM which contains the chemical for suppressing the Mega-Playboy DNA. In return, Karin gets a vast sum of money... enough to make all her dreams come true. Will Junta become the playboy he is destined to be, or will his better self prevail? But Karin is falling for the real Junta too... and what of the sweet and kindly Ami who has secretly loved Junta all her life? What will happen to future Japan?
trivia: DNA² features a "DNA Operator" named Karin Aoi, sent from the future to alter Junta Monamari's DNA.
DNA² involves a special bullet called DCM, designed to suppress the "Mega-Playboy" DNA in Junta.
DNA² depicts a future Japan plagued by overpopulation caused by Junta Monamari's descendants.

title: Bomber Girl
mu_description:
From DiscountAnimeDVD:  
Rashomon Emi is not your typical bounty hunter. Sexy and amusing, she takes her job seriously... maybe a little TOO seriously! Typically known for being so enthralled with her work that she ends up killing criminals before collecting bounty, she may just be a perfect match for future Tokyo. Chaotic and full of crime, Tokyo is a place for the strong, and none better than Rashomon Emi, aka Bomber Girl, know how to deal with crime.
trivia: Bomber Girl features a bounty hunter named Rashomon Emi as its protagonist.
Bomber Girl is set in a chaotic and crime-ridden future Tokyo.

title: Suizan Police Gang

Midoriyama, Tokyo, a crime-prone area.

Ginnosuke Tooyama, a new police officer, was assigned to the Midoriyama police station and cracks a kidnapping case the day he arrives! However, it was all thanks to Ginnosuke's twin brother, Kinnosuke, who he believes died when he was young.

Kaitani Shinobu's debut work.
trivia: Suizan Police Gang is the debut work of mangaka Shinobu Kaitani.
Suizan Police Gang features twin brothers Ginnosuke and Kinnosuke, one a police officer and the other presumed dead.
Suizan Police Gang is set in the crime-prone Midoriyama district of Tokyo.

title: Rurouni Kenshin
mu_alt_titles: Rurouni Kenshin: Una historia romántica de un espadachín de la era Meiji
ซามูไรเพนจร
るろうに剣心 -明治剣客浪漫譚-
mu_description:
From Viz:  
One hundred and forty years ago in Kyoto, with he coming of the American "Black Ships," there arose a warrior who, felling men with his bloodstained blade, gained the name Hitokiri, manslayer! His killer blade helped close the turbulent Bakumatsu era and slashed open the progressive age known as Meiji. Then he vanished, and with the flow of years, became legend.

trivia: Rurouni Kenshin volume 6 contains a prequel story titled *Crescent Moon in the Warring States*.

title: Mind Assassin
mu_alt_titles: マインド　アサシン
mu_description: There was a man who was created during the carnage of WWII. He was an assassin engineered to psychically toy with people's minds and ultimately kill them. Kazu is the third generation descendant of that man, living in peaceful modern Japan, with a job as a clinical doctor. However, when the need arises, he uses his ability to help mentally disturbed patients overcome their pasts. But when something goes horribly wrong, he takes up the role his grandfather once had...
trivia: Mind Assassin features a protagonist who is both a doctor and a psychic assassin.

title: Mortal Commando Guy

title: Rash!!

title: Midori no Makibaō
mu_alt_titles: มากิบาโอ ขาสั้นพันธุ์ซิ่ง (NED)
mu_description:
Midori Makibaoh is a small white racehorse. He looks more like a donkey with wide nostrils than other thoroughbred horses. However, with his guts and speed as his weapon, Makibaoh wins in every big race. At the beginning of his career, Makibaoh had trouble making his debut as a racehorse, because of his appearance and various disadvantages but Makibaoh had reasons to overcome his difficulties. A lifelong rival horse called Superhorse Cascade that Makibaoh needs to defeat. He is determined to win back his mother, a horse taken away to pay back the farm´s debt. Makibaoh has to overcome many hardships but thrives in a series of races to become a great racehorse.

Note: Won the 42nd Shogakukan Manga Award in the children category in 1997.
trivia: Midori no Makibaō won the 42nd Shogakukan Manga Award in the children's category in 1997.
Midori no Makibaō features a protagonist motivated to win races to earn back his mother who was taken to pay debts.

title: Shadow Lady
mu_description:
From Dark Horse:

When supernatural police officers come to take De-Mo back to the demon world for execution, Aimi, aka Shadow Lady, agrees to take on a special mission in order to save her demonic pal. Aimi must help recover the Demon Stones that were stolen and released into the human world. 

But each stone contains an imprisoned arch-demon, making Aimi's mission as deadly as it is difficult. And if the secrets of the Demon World become known to the human world, De-Mo's life will be forfeit — and so will Aimi's!
trivia: Shadow Lady protects De-Mo, a demon facing execution in the demon world.
Shadow Lady risks her own life and De-Mo's to keep the Demon World's secrets from humanity.

title: Hisoka Returns!
mu_alt_titles: Return คนเก่าในร่างใหม่
mu_description: Teacher Hisoka wakes up to find that he has died and is now inhabiting the body of the student he tried to save. This is due to the interference of a monk, who informs him that he cannot tell anyone who he really is or the bond between him and his "new" body will break and he will die for real. Hisoka chooses to retain his memories despite the monk's warning that it will cause trouble....No doubt it will, since Hisoka is the type who cannot pass someone in trouble without trying to help!

title: Majima-kun Suttobasu!!
mu_alt_titles: Jinnai Style Jiu-jitsu Martial Arts Legend Majima Goes All Out!!
ลุยแหลก แหกหลักสูตร!! (Burapat)
ลุยแหลกเกินหลักสูตร (SIC)
陣内流柔術武闘伝 真島クンすっとばす!!
mu_description: Majima Rei is a practitioner of a martial art born from the battles in the Sengoku era, the Jinnai style jujutsu. During middle school he was a delinquent but, when he became a highschool student, he swears that in order to surpass the one said to be the strongest practitioner of the Jinnai style in history, the 8th head Jounouchi Masashi, he will become the strongest martial artist in the world. For that purpose, he battles against various types of martial arts and fighters.
trivia: Majima-kun Suttobasu!! features Majima Rei, who aims to surpass the Jinnai style's strongest practitioner, Jounouchi Masashi.
Majima-kun Suttobasu!! revolves around Majima Rei battling against various martial arts and fighters to become the world's strongest.

title: Oni ga Kitarite
mu_description:
Oninobe Raiya is an oni searching for pieces of the soul of the head of his family. On his travels he meets various people who and gets involved in their various troubles.

Otaku Zone

title: Level E
mu_description: Tsutsui Yukitaka is a freshman entering high school who hopes to become a good baseball player. However, when he walks into his new apartment, there is a man in the room who claims that he is an alien who lost his memory. He is in fact the first prince of Planet Dogra, known to have the best brain but the worst nature.
trivia: Level E is a science fiction comedy manga series.
Level E features a protagonist who is the prince of Planet Dogra.
Level E centers around an alien with amnesia living in a high school student's apartment.

title: Mizu no Tomodachi Kappaman
mu_alt_titles: 水のともだちカッパーマン

title: Wild Half
mu_description:
From Manga-Koekje:  
This is a shounen manga about a high school senior named Taketo Iwase and a dog named Salsa. As they set off early on to resolve a problem with a criminal that Toshifumi (Taketo's brother) is having, Taketo sees that there is more to the dog (that can communicate in the human language) than meets the eye. Together they solve a number of troubles and also meet other different species (cat girls, dogs, birds, etc). Wild Half has some very funny gag lines, some moving plots, helpful morals, in short, a little bit of everything packaged into one. (Shortened review written by Si)
trivia: Wild Half features a dog named Salsa who can communicate in human language.
Wild Half contains elements of gag comedy, moving plots, and helpful morals.

title: Hoshin Engi
mu_alt_titles: ตำนานเทพประยุทธ์
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Armed with his new weapon, the Dashinben, Taikobo seeks revenge on the demon Dakki and her sinister sisters. He finds out much more about the godlike Sennins--and what may have really happened to his clan. But looking for survivors only means falling further into Dakki's darkness.  
Buy now
trivia: Hoshin Engi features the character Taikobo wielding a weapon called the Dashinben.
Hoshin Engi centers around Taikobo's quest for revenge against the demon Dakki.
Hoshin Engi involves godlike beings known as Sennins.

title: One Piece
mu_description:
From Viz:  
As a child, Monkey D. Luffy was inspired to become a pirate by listening to the tales of the buccaneer "Red-Haired" Shanks. But his life changed when Luffy accidentally ate the Gum-Gum Devil Fruit and gained the power to stretch like rubber at the cost of never being able to swim again. Years later, still vowing to become the king of the pirates, Luffy sets out on his adventure one guy alone in a rowboat, in search of the legendary "One Piece," said to be the greatest treasure in the world.

[Read for FREE on Manga Plus](https://mangaplus.shueisha.co.jp/titles/100020)

The best-selling series in manga history and the 2nd bestselling comic of all time after Superman.

Note: Was a finalist for the Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize from 2000 to 2002. The German translation won the Sondermann audience award at the Frankfurt Book Fair Comics Centre in 2005, 2008 and 2009. Won the 41st Japan Cartoonists Association Award Grand Prize alongside [Neko Darake](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=48911469395) in 2012. Received the Kumamoto Prefecture Honorary Prize in 2018.
categories: Rape as a Start of Relationship
trivia: One Piece is the best-selling manga series in history.
One Piece features a protagonist, Luffy, who ate a Devil Fruit giving him rubber-like abilities.
One Piece was a finalist for the Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize for three consecutive years.

title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
mu_alt_titles: เกมกลคนอัจฉริยะ (SIC)
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Sitting by himself in the back of the class, 10th-grader Yugi always had his head in some game--until he solved the Millennium Puzzle, an Egyptian artifact containing a powerful spirit from the age of the pharaohs. Awakened after three thousand years, the King of Games possesses Yugi, recklessly challenging bullies and evildoers to the Shadow Games, where the stakes are high and even the most ordinary bet may result in weirdness and danger beyond belief. Let the games begin.

This section of the original [Yu-Gi-Oh!](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=68749871234) series and covers the beginning of the series where the card game wasn't the main focus. Continues in [Yu-Gi-Oh! Duelist](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=46214085769).
trivia: Yu-Gi-Oh! initially focused on Shadow Games, where Yugi, possessed by an ancient spirit, challenged wrongdoers to dangerous contests beyond just card games.
Yu-Gi-Oh! begins with Yugi solving the Millennium Puzzle, an Egyptian artifact that awakens a powerful spirit from the age of the pharaohs.
Yu-Gi-Oh! is divided into two sections in its manga form: one focused on the initial Shadow Games and another titled 'Yu-Gi-Oh! Duelist' that emphasizes the card game.

title: Naruto
mu_alt_titles: นินจาคาถาโอ้โฮเฮะ
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Twelve years ago the Village Hidden in the Leaves was attacked by a fearsome threat. A nine-tailed fox spirit claimed the life of the village leader, the Hokage, and many others. Today, the village is at peace and a troublemaking kid named Naruto is struggling to graduate from Ninja Academy. His goal may be to become the next Hokage, but his true destiny will be much more complicated. The adventure begins now.

[Read for FREE on Manga Plus](https://mangaplus.shueisha.co.jp/titles/100018)

Note: Nominated for the 19th Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize and won the "Rookie of the Year" award in the media fine arts category by the Agency for Cultural Affairs in 2015.
trivia: Naruto was nominated for the 19th Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize.
Naruto features a protagonist named Naruto who dreams of becoming the Hokage.

title: Monsters
mu_description: Monsters were hunted for their Monsters Organs that are then implanted into humans to try to achieve eternal youth and eternal beauty. But the implants aren't always successful. Most have reactions to the implants. But a normal doctor cannot remove them once implanted. Asura is the last surviving monster and the only one that can remove these monster organs...

title: Butsu Zone
mu_alt_titles: เซนจู เทวฤทธิ์พันมือ
mu_description:
From MangaCity:  
Of Shaman King fame, here's another series by Hiroyuki Takei about a buddha with the 1,000 arms armor. Sennju, an emissary of the buddha Kannon, appears in the human world to find and protect the reincarnation of the buddha Mirokou. The emissary arrives on Earth just in time to save a young girl from being bullied by some rough looking men. Just who is this girl and will she believe that he's a buddha who was sent by Kannon?

* Also included are three oneshots; two of them are called *Death Zero* and *Itako no Anna*.

• *Death Zero*   
A WWII pilot was shot down and killed, but he still had a promise to keep, that not even death could stop him.

• *Itako no Anna*   
Anna is an Itako, a priestess who can call upon spirits, learning the trade with her grandmother. One day, they run into a temple to find the master of the temple quarreling with a sword collector over whether the sword may be removed from the temple or not. And she and her grandmother decide to call upon the original owner of the sword and aid the temple master.
trivia: Butsu Zone features Sennju, an emissary of the buddha Kannon, tasked with protecting Mirokou's reincarnation.
Butsu Zone shares a creator, Hiroyuki Takei, with the more popular manga series Shaman King.
Butsu Zone includes two oneshots, 'Death Zero' and 'Itako no Anna', the latter featuring a young Itako priestess.

title: I"s
mu_description: Shy Ichitaka has a crush on his high-school classmate Iori, but ever since she posed for semi-provocative swimsuit photos in a magazine, she's had a lot of sleazy guys hitting on her. Ichitaka's afraid to make his feelings known for fear Iori will think he's just another creep. (From [Viz](/group/ksdpvn1/viz))
trivia: I"s was serialized in Weekly Shonen Jump, a magazine known for action-oriented manga, making its romance theme a notable contrast.
I"s is a romantic comedy manga series written and illustrated by Masakazu Katsura.
I"s features a protagonist, Ichitaka Seto, who struggles with his shyness and expressing his feelings to Iori Yoshizuki.

title: Kishibe Rohan wa Ugokanai
mu_alt_titles: คิชิเบะ โรฮัง ไม่เคลื่อนไหว (NED)
岸辺露伴 新宿へ行く
mu_description:
From Viz:  
A standalone series featuring everyone’s favorite manga artist, Rohan Kishibe. Rohan has freed himself of Josuke Higashikata, but that doesn’t mean his life is going to be easy. No, now the supernatural has come knocking, and Rohan must contend with an all-new level of bizarre adventure.

Vol 1 (2013):  
1. Episode 16: At a Confessional (1997) - Also included in [Shikei Shikkouchuu Datsugoku Shinkouchuu](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=40948254190).  
2. Episode 2: Mutsu-kabe Hill (2007)  
3. Episode 5: Millionaire Village (2012)  
4. Episode 6: Poaching Seashore (2013)  
5. Kishibe Rohan Meets Gucci (2011)

Vol 2 (2018):  
6. Episode 4: The Harvest Moon (2014)  
7. Episode 7: A Rainy Monday (2015)  
8. Episode 8: Deoxyribonucleic Acid (2017)  
9. Episode 9: The Run (2018)

Uncollected:  
10. Episode 10: Hot Summer Martha (2022)  
11. Episode 11: Drip Painting Style, Part 1 & Part 2 (2022)
12. Episode 12: Bruschetta (2025)
trivia: Kishibe Rohan wa Ugokanai features standalone stories centered on the character Rohan Kishibe.
Kishibe Rohan wa Ugokanai includes the story "Kishibe Rohan Meets Gucci," indicating a collaboration with the fashion brand.

title: Romancers
mu_description: Takara is a Romancer, a being that can make words come to life. In his case, he can make any "lie" a lie in real life. He uses his special talent to help people while searching for others like him, but when he saved his cop friend Wakisaka, his powers were strengthened and Takara's powers changed so he could use them when he is deeply moved.

title: Kappa Revolution
mu_alt_titles: 河童レボリューション

title: Cowa!
mu_description:
From Viz:  
A contagious Monster Flu is spreading around town like wildfire. Can the town's troublemaker and his friends get the medicine in time to save everyone?!  
Paifu, a half-vampire half-werekoala, is always getting into trouble. With his trusty sidekick, Jose the ghost, he's out stealing watermelons, befriending murderers and causing a ruckus. But not everything is fun and games when the contagious Monster Flu sweeps through town. If the sick monsters don't get some medicine within a month, everyone will die! But only the one who has the medicine is the Witch who lives high atop Horned-Owl Mountain...750 miles away! With the help of a former sumo wrestler, Paifu, Jose and tagalong Arpon are off on an adventure! But, will they get the medicine in time or will they become victims themselves?!
trivia: Cowa! features a protagonist, Paifu, who is a hybrid of a vampire and a werekoala.
Cowa! involves a quest to retrieve medicine from a witch to combat a deadly Monster Flu.
Cowa! includes a former sumo wrestler as a member of the main character's traveling party.

title: Bad Shield United
mu_description:
Somewhere in the desert lies the world's greatest treasure: the 12 Rings of the Dead, the only source of the mysterious substance Zombie Powder, which can raise the dead and grant eternal life. Into this world stalks Gamma Akutabi, a man with a metal arm and a six-foot chainsaw, cybernetically enhanced master of the legendary martial art.   
But it takes more than one man to find the ultimate prize. You need a team: super-gunman C.T. Smith, knife-slinging teenager Elwood, and brilliant (and impossibly big-breasted) journalist Wolfgangina. Against an army of crooks and killers, against runaway trains and super-powered madmen, they'll need all their skills... but the most dangerous thing in the west might be the Rings themselves.

Includes 3 one-shots:  
- *Ultra Unholy Hearted Machine* Vol 2  
- *Rune Master Urara* Vol 3  
- *Bad Shield United* Vol 4
trivia: Bad Shield United features a protagonist named Gamma Akutabi who wields a six-foot chainsaw.
Bad Shield United mentions a highly sought-after treasure called the 12 Rings of the Dead.
Bad Shield United includes one-shot stories "Ultra Unholy Hearted Machine" and "Rune Master Urara" within its volumes.

title: Rookies
mu_alt_titles: มือใหม่ไฟแรง
ルーキーズ ~夢のつづき~
mu_description: Koichi Kawato is the new Japanese teacher at the ill-famed Futakotamagawa high school, whose baseball club is composed of thugs and bullies who have been suspended for a year from all school competitions, for causing a brawl during an official match. The newly appointed teacher finds that the club members left are only interested in women, smoking and doing nothing until, under Kawato's guidance, they discover a new dream called the Koshien. However, the road to the Koshien is far from easy as many obstacles await them.
trivia: Rookies features a teacher, Koichi Kawato, who inspires a delinquent baseball club to aim for Koshien.
Rookies follows a group of students who were more interested in delinquency than baseball before being guided by their teacher.

title: Whistle!
mu_alt_titles: Đường Dẫn Đến Khung Thành - bộ IV
ไอ้หนูแข้งทอง (NED)
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Banned from his school's soccer team for being too short, Shô Kazamatsuri decides there's only one thing left to do: switch schools. But even a change in scenery doesn't help the David Beckham wannabe. On campus, he is mistakenly introduced to everyone as a hotshot soccer player.   
When the truth is revealed, Shô drops out of school to practice on his own. Alone, the spunky teenager must work twice as hard to make his dreams come true. He wants to play soccer so bad he's willing to hustle day and night to make it happen.
trivia: Whistle! features a protagonist named Sho Kazamatsuri who was initially banned from his school's soccer team due to his height.
Whistle! involves Sho Kazamatsuri switching schools after being banned from the soccer team.
Whistle! depicts Sho Kazamatsuri working hard to achieve his soccer dreams after dropping out of school.

title: Kajika
mu_description: Kajika's a trouble making little boy, part of the mysteriously empowered people of the ''Kawa'' clan. When one day he intentionally and cruelly kills a fox, the fox's spirit comes back and places a curse on the boy, turning him into a half-fox and severely limiting his abilities. The only way to break the curse is to save one thousand lives. And so Kajika sets out on a journey, accompanied by the fox's spirit. However, when he obtains the egg of the last remaining dragon on Earth, all hell breaks loose as he is forced to take on the forces of a merciless gangster who seeks the power that resides in a dragon's blood... While at the same time attempting to break the curse and finding out the rumours of what happened to his family of the Kawa clan.
trivia: Kajika 's curse requires him to save one thousand lives to revert back to his human form.
Kajika is accompanied on his journey by the spirit of the fox he killed.
Kajika becomes embroiled in conflict after obtaining the egg of the last dragon on Earth.

title: Rising Impact
mu_alt_titles: ライジング インパクト
ライジングインパクト
mu_description: A young boy, Gawain, lives in a mountainous, rural area with an incredible love for baseball and making the ball really fly. One day he runs into a visitor to the small area and she introduces him to a sport that can really make a ball take to flight, golf! It just takes one shot and Gawain is hooked. With his grandpa's approval he sets off to Tokyo with this mysterious woman to learn all he can about golf, encountering many colorful characters and obstacles along the way.
trivia: Rising Impact focuses on the sport of golf, a departure from typical Shonen Jump themes.
Rising Impact follows a boy named Gawain who transitions from baseball to golf.
Rising Impact begins with Gawain being introduced to golf by a mysterious woman.

title: Hikaru no Go
mu_alt_titles: ฮิคารุเซียนโกะ
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Hikaru Shindo is like any sixth-grader in Japan: a pretty normal schoolboy with a two-tone head of hair and a penchant for antics. One day, he finds an old bloodstained Go board in his grandfather's attic and that's when things get really interesting. Trapped inside the Go board is Fujiwara-no-Sai, the ghost of an ancient Go master who taught the strategically complex board game to the emperor of Japan many centuries ago.  
In one fateful moment, Sai becomes a part of Hikaru's consciousness and together, through thick and thin, they make an unstoppable Go-playing team. Will they be able to defeat Go players who have dedicated their lives to the game?   
Will Sai achieve the "Divine Move" so he'll finally be able to rest in peace?

Note: Won the Shogakukan Manga Award in 2000. Won the Creative Award in the 7th Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize in 2003.
categories: Emulating A Person Whom One Admires
trivia: Hikaru no Go won the Shogakukan Manga Award in 2000.
Hikaru no Go features a protagonist haunted by the ghost of an ancient Go master.
Hikaru no Go won the Creative Award in the 7th Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize in 2003.

title: Neko Majin ga Iru
mu_description:
Neko Majin is a parody of Dragonball Z by Akira Toriyama. The protagonist Neko Majin fights evil-doers and has a few other Dragonball Z-esque adventures.

Short stories :

• Neko Majin 

• Neko Majin Z 

• Neko Majin Mike
trivia: Neko Majin ga Iru is a self-parody by Akira Toriyama, the creator of Dragon Ball Z.
Neko Majin ga Iru features a character named Neko Majin Z, clearly referencing Dragon Ball Z.
Neko Majin ga Iru consists of several short stories including 'Neko Majin', 'Neko Majin Z', and 'Neko Majin Mike'.

title: Survibee
mu_description:
The bee Bazou lost family and friends due to the long rain, but lived casual with fellow insects in the same situation. One day, Bazou, who got up early and flew around the forest as usual, found an injured bee and ran up. While a horde of wasps flew over the sky, the bee held back the hornet, leaving behind a mysterious soliloquy and entrusting the mysterious object "Odai" to the hornet, disappearing into the horde of wasps.

Bazou returns to the house with "Odai" where friends are waiting, but he is informed of the shocking fact that many of Bazou's fellow bees were killed by a horde of wasps. He takes "Odai" and seeks the survival of honeybees with his friends, and plans to rebuild the honeybee kingdom.   
Wasps, aiming for "Oudai", invade their dwelling place and kill their friends one after another. Everyone but Bazou died.

Soon after, Bazoo leaves alone with "Oudai".
trivia: Survibee centers on Bazou's quest for survival and rebuilding the honeybee kingdom after a devastating wasp attack.
Survibee features a mysterious object called "Odai" that is crucial to the plot and sought after by wasps.

title: Stone Ocean
mu_title: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken Part 6: Stone Ocean
mu_alt_titles: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure Part 6: Stone Ocean
La extraña Aventura de JoJo Parte 6: El Océano de Piedra
ماجراجویی عجیب و غریب جوجو بخش ۶: سنگ اقیانوس
ジョジョの奇妙な冒険Part 6: ストーンオーシャン
mu_description:
From Viz:  
JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure shifts the action from Italy to America, as Jolyne Cujoh, daughter of Jotaro Kujo, is sentenced to 15 years in prison for a murder she didn’t commit! In a bizarre turn of events, the prison is filled with Stand users. Some become her allies, but many are sent to kill Jolyne and her friends in a scheme to resurrect the scourge of the Joestar family DIO!   
It’s a battle for survival in a prison where death lurks around every corner while Jolyne fights to save her father’s life.

The last part of the original timeline. From Part 7, the story takes place in a separate universe.
trivia: Stone Ocean features Jolyne Cujoh, the daughter of Jotaro Kujo, as the main protagonist.
Stone Ocean is the sixth part of the JoJo's Bizarre Adventure series.
Stone Ocean is the final part of the original JoJo's Bizarre Adventure timeline before the universe was rebooted in Part 7.

title: Bremen
mu_alt_titles: หนุ่มเฮี้ยวพันธุ์ระห่ำ
mu_description: Reiji and Kasuga head out to Tokyo to become the "Gods of Rock," but they seem to always attract trouble. On their way, Hayama Ryo and Fujii Ran join them in their quest.

title: Lilim Kiss
mu_description: Saiki Takaya, a guy who is easily misunderstood, one day finds a flask containing the succubus Lilim. She is very attractive but, she also has the tendency to drain the life force out of people. She surprises the life out of him (literally) when she kisses him unconscious. Lilim then flies off for more "food," but returns later, saying that Takaya's life-energy was the "tastiest." From then, Lilim is accepted by Takaya's parents as a live-in girlfriend of sorts, and Takaya's heart seems to start wavering towards this voluptuous devil.

title: Sand Land
mu_description:
From Viz:  
In the far future, war has destroyed the entire Earth, leaving only a barren wasteland called Sand Land where the supply of water is controlled by the greedy king. In search of a long-lost lake, Sheriff Rao asked the king of the demons for help... and got the king's son, Beelzebub, and his assistant, Thief. Together the unlikely trio sets off across the desert, facing dragons, bandits, and the deadliest foe of all... the King's Army itself! It's travel adventure and tank action in this new story from the creator of Dragon Ball!
trivia: Sand Land is written and illustrated by Akira Toriyama, the creator of Dragon Ball.
Sand Land features a trio consisting of a sheriff, a demon prince, and a thief as its main characters.
Sand Land depicts a post-apocalyptic world ravaged by war, where water is a scarce and controlled resource.

title: Normandy Secret Club
mu_alt_titles: ノルマンディーひみつ倶楽部

title: Black Cat
mu_description:
Train Heartnet, also known as “Black Cat,” was an infamous assassin for a secret organization called Chronos...until he abandoned that cold-blooded existence to live on his own terms as an easygoing bounty hunter. But is Train’s past as far behind him as he thinks?

**Official English Release:**  
[Viz](https://www.viz.com/black-cat)
categories: Character/s Trying to Live a Normal Life
trivia: Black Cat follows Train Heartnet's transition from assassin to bounty hunter.

title: Kaizer Spike
mu_alt_titles: カイゼル スパイク

title: Rocket de Tsukinukero!
mu_alt_titles: ロケットでつきぬけろ!
mu_description: Mitsuo Haruta had five days to drive his cart which break the record  of Shingo Akagia legendary racer. Miyoshi worshipped Akagi saw his real driving in Suzuka that he wanted to become a racer.

title: Pyu to Fuku! Jaguar
mu_alt_titles: ピューと吹く!ジャガー
ピューと吹く！ジャガー
mu_description: Piyohiko has a dream: He wants to be a succesfull guitar-player. Then this guy Jaguar shows up, and coaxes him into playing the recorder, thus ending Piyohiko's noble dream.

title: Tattoo Hearts
mu_description: When a strange ink is discovered in the basement of a tattoo shop. The lives of two people start to change. This ink, one of the tattoo hearts, allows the wearer to access superhuman abilities when their heart matches their tattoo.

title: Gun Blaze West
mu_alt_titles: ガン ブレイズ ウエスト
mu_description:
From [Viz](/publisher/91qzdxd/viz):  
In the Old West only the strong survive. Viu Bannes is a boy on a mission to be the best gunfighter in the West. When Viu meets a vagabond gunslinger named Marcus Homer, his desire to be the best becomes even stronger. He knows it's his destiny to travel to the legendary land known as Gun Blaze West--where only the toughest gunmen dare set foot!
trivia: Gun Blaze West features a protagonist, Viu Bannes, who aims to become the best gunfighter.
Gun Blaze West follows Viu's journey towards a legendary land called Gun Blaze West.
Gun Blaze West depicts a setting in the Old West where survival depends on strength.

title: Dr. Chanbelee
mu_description: A touching story of a doctor who wanted to help people even though he became a vampire.

title: Isetsu: Hoshin Engi
mu_alt_titles: ตำนานเทพประยุทธ์
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Armed with his new weapon, the Dashinben, Taikobo seeks revenge on the demon Dakki and her sinister sisters. He finds out much more about the godlike Sennins--and what may have really happened to his clan. But looking for survivors only means falling further into Dakki's darkness.  
Buy now
trivia: Isetsu: Hoshin Engi centers around Taikobo seeking revenge on the demon Dakki.
Isetsu: Hoshin Engi involves godlike beings called Sennins.

title: Mr. Fullswing
mu_description:
From Ignition-One:  
Baseball, girls, gags, and one big idiot, that's Mr Fullswing for you. The new generation of sports/gag manga has been born with the release of this insane series. So what are you waiting for? Get to reading!
trivia: Mr. Fullswing is a sports/gag manga focusing on baseball.
Mr. Fullswing features an "idiot" protagonist, according to its description.

title: Kicks Megamix
mu_alt_titles: キックスメガミックス
mu_description: Akagi Taichi is high school troublemaker who transfers to a new school. He enjoys Martial Arts, and he decides to visit the new dojo. What he doesn't know is that the school has a ghost story: if you look at the picture of the dojo's founder, Chiba Shunsuke, he moves. But not only does Chiba move, he inhabits Akagi's body!
trivia: Kicks Megamix features a protagonist, Akagi Taichi, who is a high school transfer student and known troublemaker.
Kicks Megamix involves a ghost named Chiba Shunsuke who inhabits the body of the protagonist.
Kicks Megamix centers around a dojo with a haunted picture of its founder.

title: Bleach
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Ichigo Kurosaki has always been able to see ghosts, but this ability doesn't change his life nearly as much as his close encounter with Rukia Kuchiki, a Soul Reaper and member of the mysterious Soul Society. While fighting a Hollow, an evil spirit that preys on humans who display psychic energy, Rukia attempts to lend Ichigo some of her powers so that he can save his family; but much to her surprise, Ichigo absorbs every last drop of her energy. Now a full-fledged Soul Reaper himself, Ichigo quickly learns that the world he inhabits is one full of dangerous spirits and, along with Rukia - who is slowly regaining her powers - it's Ichigo's job to protect the innocent from Hollows and help the spirits themselves find peace.

[Read for FREE on Manga Plus](https://mangaplus.shueisha.co.jp/titles/100004)

Note: Won the 50th Shogakukan Manga Award in the Shounen category in 2005.
trivia: Bleach won the 50th Shogakukan Manga Award in the Shounen category in 2005.
Bleach features Ichigo Kurosaki, who becomes a Soul Reaper after absorbing Rukia Kuchiki's powers.

title: Toriko
mu_description:
From Viz:  
This is the great era of gourmet food! And only Toriko can hunt down the ferocious ingredients that supply the world's best restaurants. As a Gourmet Hunter, Toriko tracks and defeats the tastiest and most dangerous animals with his bare hands. But has he met his match with an eight-legged alligator the size of a tank?

Note: Nominated for the 2nd Manga Taisho Award in 2009.
trivia: Toriko is a Gourmet Hunter who tracks and defeats dangerous animals for ingredients.
Toriko was nominated for the 2nd Manga Taisho Award in 2009.
Toriko stars a character who hunts with his bare hands.

title: Sword Breaker
mu_description: A long time ago, in a certain world, the evil magician Aval was thoroughly defeated by a brave man Ruldo, who carried "Sword Breaker". Unfortunately, Ruldo was banished by Aval's curse into a different world. Now, will the call for a hero bring Ruldo back into his original world once more?
trivia: Sword Breaker features a protagonist named Ruldo who wields the titular weapon.
Sword Breaker involves a hero transported to a different world due to a curse.
Sword Breaker pits Ruldo against the evil magician Aval.

title: Ichigo 100%
mu_description: Junpei Manaka sneaks up to the roof to see the sunset. When he opens the door, he startles a mysterious beauty. She panics and runs away, but not before Junpei has caught sight of her adorable strawberry print panties...in EXTREME close-up. With that vision forever burned into his memory, Junpei embarks on a quest to find the girl, and the panties, of his dreams!
trivia: Ichigo 100% features a male protagonist named Junpei Manaka driven by his quest to find a girl based on a glimpse of her strawberry patterned underwear.
Ichigo 100% is a romantic comedy manga where the main character, Junpei, dreams of becoming a film director.
Ichigo 100% revolves around Junpei's pursuit of romance intertwined with his aspiration to work in the film industry.

title: Eyeshield 21
mu_alt_titles: Eyeshield 21 - ไอ้หนูไต้ฝุ่นมะกันบอล (NED)
mu_description:
From Viz:  
What does a wimpy kid who's been bullied all his life have to depend on but his own two feet? Sena Kobayakawa is about to start his first year in high school and he's vowed not to get picked on anymore. Unfortunately, the sadistic captain of the football team already has his eye on Sena and his lightning-fast speed.
trivia: Eyeshield 21 features Sena Kobayakawa, a bullied freshman with exceptional running speed.
Eyeshield 21 revolves around American football, despite the main character's initial reluctance.

title: Pretty Face
mu_alt_titles: เก๋าโจ๋โก๋พันธุ์สวย
プリティ　フェイス
mu_description:
Randou Masashi, a self-centered, brash karate star, was the victim of a horrific bus accident that left him comatose, his face terribly disfigured by extensive burns.

Genius plastic surgeon Dr. Manabe saved Randou's life and went to work on his face, gradually reconstructing it based on a photograph found in the wreckage of the bus. But in a cruel twist of fate, the photo that the doctor used as his reference was not a picture of Randou, but of Rina Kurimi, the girl whom Randou has a crush on!
trivia: Pretty Face ran for a relatively short duration, spanning only six tankobon volumes.
Pretty Face features a protagonist whose appearance is unintentionally modeled after his crush.
Pretty Face is a manga centered around a protagonist's altered identity due to reconstructive surgery.

title: Cross Beat
mu_description:
This is about a lazy baseball player, Taro, and a very serious baseball player, Takami, who want to make it to the top. They cross paths on a bus that crashes. Takami dies and Taro lives. Taro visits Takami's grave and sees Takami's ghost. His ghost tells Taro to "switch" with him and take him to the koshien to fulfil his dream.

Included in this manga are three unrelated short stories:

-  *Usagi to Kame to Strike*

- *Live Alive*

- *Cross Beat*
trivia: Cross Beat features a protagonist, Taro, who inherits the baseball dream of a deceased player named Takami.
Cross Beat involves a supernatural element, with Takami appearing as a ghost.
Cross Beat is comprised of three different baseball themed short stories with 'Cross Beat' being one of them.

title: Ultra Red
mu_description: How strong are you? In this manga, the hero is an idiotic little boy who has a frightening style of fighting. But he isn't the only fighting monster. Sumeragi Sen will discover people that are stronger than him, and maybe even the limits of his strength.

title: Hajime
mu_description: Two kids, Kouhei and Akio, made up an imaginary girl named Hajime to take the blame for destruction of the principal's copper statue. But one day, they meet a girl that is exactly like their description of Hajime, but only they can see her.

title: Kannade
mu_alt_titles: อาคิโตะ หัตถ์เทวดา
mu_description:
Hayama Akita is also known as a Masterpieces thief : God Hand. But the art pieces he stole are copies painted by his missing mom.

One day he was caught by a black market broker. A mysterious mark appears in his desparation to escape, as does his new ability, "Kannade".

title: Gintama
mu_description:
During the Edo period, Japan is suddenly invaded by alien creatures known as the "Amanto." Despite the samurai's attempts to combat the extraterrestrial menace, the Shogun soon realizes that their efforts are futile and decides to surrender. This marks the beginning of an uneasy agreement between the Shogunate and Amanto, one that results in a countrywide sword ban and the disappearance of the samurai spirit.

However, there exists one eccentric individual who wields a wooden sword and refuses to let his samurai status die. Now that his kind are no longer needed, Gintoki Sakata performs various odd jobs around town in order to make ends meet. Joined by his self-proclaimed disciple Shinpachi Shimura, the fearsome alien Kagura, and a giant dog named Sadaharu, they run the business known as Yorozuya, often getting caught up in all sorts of crazy and hilarious shenanigans.

Volume 2 contains Shirokuro   
There is a young professional "curser" who, trought mystical methods and a baseball bat, brings punishment to what law doesn't punish, and to bring calm to hateful hearts. She meets a demon that tells her to give up her "work," to keep the harmony between the human and supernatural worlds.

Volume 24 contains 13 (サーティーン)

Volume 38 contains Bankara (ばんから)  
The cyber revolution seems to be a new weapon that school delinquents take advantage of and cause damage. A chair woman named, Miyamoto Shizuka, possesses the power to keep things in order. But what will happen to the fate of the school when she mistakenly lets the rumored legendary BANKARA, named Gouda Takeru, free?
trivia: Gintama features an alien invasion of Edo-period Japan by creatures called Amanto.

title: Santa!
mu_description:
Five years ago, a mysterious Akuma appeared... However, one man stopped the Akuma in its tracks: his name is Alalakit. The story starts off with Jikeina and Santa. Jikeina is Santa's older brother, and they made a living by getting rid of monsters or stopping monsters from invading a village. However, Santa has a mark on his left hand; it is the mark of the Akuma. Actually, it's the mark of "Mahou's Power." There are 108 of the Akuma's powers, and they are passed down to "successors." Each animal who has the blood of the Akuma is changed into a youkai, but only the most powerful of the lot are given one of the Akuma's powers, and they will have a mark on a part of their body as evidence that they inherited the power of the Akuma. Santa has the symbol of a star on his hand, and on it is the number 0. In a battle with a youkai who has the Mahou's Power of fire, Jikeina is separated from Santa, and Santa had just discovered what is his Mahou power... it's something to do with the mouth on his stomach... Alone, Santa travels to all kinds of places, making new friends, defeating new enemies, and learning the secret of the Akuma, whilst seeking Jikeina.  
From souhaku scan
trivia: Santa! features a protagonist named Santa who possesses the "Mahou's Power," specifically the number 0.
Santa! centers on a quest where Santa searches for his older brother, Jikeina, while battling youkai.
Santa! involves 108 distinct "Mahou's Powers" that originate from the Akuma and are inherited by successors.

title: Buso Renkin
mu_alt_titles: นักรบเหล็กเทวะ
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Talk about being at the wrong place at the wrong time! High school student Kazuki Muto had no clue what he was in for when he rescued damsel in distress Tokiko from a monster known as a "homunculus." Disguised as humans--who actually eat humans--homunculi are malevolent creatures that affix themselves to people's brains, and once fully grown, the only thing that can annihilate them is a weapon called Buso Renkin.  
Follow the adventures of Kazuki after he discovers that it was actually Tokiko who saved his life by implanting a kakugane--an alchemical device that transforms into a buso renkin--to replace his heart.

Note: Vol 10 includes the pilot story *Embalming —Corpse and Bride—* along with liner notes for both it and *Busou Renkin*.
trivia: Buso Renkin involves monsters called homunculi that disguise themselves as humans and feed on them.
Buso Renkin follows Kazuki Muto after he receives a Kakugane that replaces his heart.
Buso Renkin volume 10 includes the pilot story *Embalming —Corpse and Bride—.

title: Continue
mu_description: About a boy of thirteen years who always tries to be a hero and for various reasons is involved with monsters, ending in his death, but it revived with the help a little thing (one might say that is the predecessor of innocence) and now must fight the Count ancient.

title: Death Note
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Light tests the boundaries of the Death Note's powers as L and the police begin to close in. Luckily Light's father is the head of the Japanese National Police Agency and leaves vital information about the case lying around the house. With access to his father's files, Light can keep one step ahead of the authorities. But who is the strange man following him, and how can Light guard against enemies whose names he doesn't know?

[Original Manga](https://www.shueisha.co.jp/books/search/search.html?seriesid=48352&order=1)

[Read for FREE on Manga Plus](https://mangaplus.shueisha.co.jp/titles/100008)

Note: Won the Eagle Award for Favourite Manga in 2008. Was nominated as Best Manga at the 2006 American Anime Awards, the 2007 Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize, an Official Selection at Angoulême International Comics Festival 2008 and Obata was nominated for Best Penciller/Inker at the 2008 Eisner Awards.
categories: Emulating A Person Whom One Admires
trivia: Death Note won the Eagle Award for Favourite Manga in 2008.
Death Note was nominated for Best Manga at the 2006 American Anime Awards.
Death Note was an Official Selection at the Angoulême International Comics Festival 2008.

title: Neko Majin Mike
mu_description:
Neko Majin is a parody of Dragonball Z by Akira Toriyama. The protagonist Neko Majin fights evil-doers and has a few other Dragonball Z-esque adventures.

Short stories :

• Neko Majin 

• Neko Majin Z 

• Neko Majin Mike
trivia: Neko Majin Mike is a parody of Akira Toriyama's Dragon Ball Z.
Neko Majin Mike features a protagonist called Neko Majin who engages in Dragonball Z-esque adventures.
Neko Majin Mike is part of a series of short stories, including "Neko Majin" and "Neko Majin Z."
