mu_description: Exotica and Diary of Exotica are 2 separate oneshots

title: Sengoku Rappaden Sasori
mu_alt_titles: せんごくらっぱでんサソリ

title: Katekyō Hitman Reborn!
mu_alt_titles: ครูพิเศษจอมป่วน Reborn! รีบอร์น
mu_description: Tsuna comes home one day, only to be greeted by a little baby mafioso who apparently is his new home tutor. His job is to guide Tsuna into his role as the 10th Boss of the Vongola mafia family. With the help of all his new friends and an array of special items such as the "Dying Will Bullet", he might just be able to do it.
trivia: Katekyō Hitman Reborn! initially began as a gag manga before transitioning into a battle series.
Katekyō Hitman Reborn! features a protagonist, Tsuna, who is initially portrayed as an underachieving and reluctant future mafia boss.
Katekyō Hitman Reborn! utilizes a special bullet, the "Dying Will Bullet," to temporarily empower the protagonist.

title: Steel Ball Run
mu_title: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken Part 7: Steel Ball Run
mu_alt_titles: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure Part 7: Steel Ball Run
La extraña aventura de JoJo Parte 7: La carrera de las bolas de acero
STEEL　BALL　RUN　スティール・ボール・ラン
ジョジョの奇妙な冒険 Part7 STEEL BALL RUN
mu_description:
Set in the U.S. in 1890, the story follows Johnny Joestar, a paraplegic ex-jockey, and Gyro Zeppeli, master in a mystic art named the Spin, as they compete with a vast number of others in the Steel Ball Run race: a mad-dash across America for a grand prize of 50 million dollars.

The first part of the new timeline. Features many changes, such as the new Joestar family line, but retaining core features of the series as Stands.
trivia: Steel Ball Run is a cross-country race across America with a grand prize of 50 million dollars.
Steel Ball Run features a paraplegic ex-jockey named Johnny Joestar as one of the main characters.
Steel Ball Run is the first part of a new timeline in the *JoJo's Bizarre Adventure* series, while still retaining the Stand mechanic.

title: Kain
mu_description: Kain is a story about a blue-eyed boy wandering the countryside. He happens to be in a town controlled by "kidoushi." These kidoushi are people from the newborn country of Ren, who have a machine in their body, giving them power equal to an army in return for pain proportionate to that power. The power of the kidoushi is determined by the amount of gigai (the machine) taken up in their body.
trivia: Kain features antagonists called "kidoushi" who derive power from a machine implanted in their bodies.
Kain takes place in a countryside setting affected by the newly established country of Ren.

title: D.Gray-man
mu_alt_titles: ดี.เกรย์ แมน (VBK)
mu_description:
From Viz:  
A born exorcist, Walker's primary anti-akuma weapon is the cross that's embossed on his red, disfigured left hand, which contains Innocence. But not only does Walker destroy akuma, he sees the akuma hiding inside a person's soul! Together with his fellow exorcists fighting under the command of the Black Order, Walker leads the battle against the Millennium Earl, the evil being out to destroy mankind.
trivia: D.Gray-man centers on the conflict between the Black Order's exorcists and the Millennium Earl's quest to destroy mankind.
D.Gray-man features Allen Walker's ability to see the akuma hiding within a person's soul.

title: Muhyo & Roji's Bureau of Supernatural Investigation
mu_title: Muhyo to Rouji no Mahouritsu Soudan Jimusho
mu_alt_titles: Muhyo & Roji's Bureau of Supernatural Investigation
Muhyo y Rouji: Bufete de Investigación Sobrenatural
สำนักงานไขคดีสารพัดปีศาจของมุเฮียว & โรซี่
ムヒョとロージーの魔法律相談事務所
mu_description: Are you a victim of unwanted spirit possession? Is there a ghost you need sent up and away...or down to burn for all eternity? If the answer is yes, then you need Muhyo and Rouji, experts in magic law. Serving justice to evil spirits is their speciality.
trivia: Muhyo & Roji's Bureau of Supernatural Investigation won the Shogakukan Manga Award for Best Children's Manga in 2006.
Muhyo & Roji's Bureau of Supernatural Investigation features a magic system heavily based on real-world legal concepts.
Muhyo & Roji's Bureau of Supernatural Investigation was adapted into two anime television series.

title: Trans Boy
mu_description:
From PopulationGO

Sorato Kenzaki is an ordinary boy who attracts not so ordinary women. He constantly gets confessed to by weird, and often dangerous, girls.  So when a rich ojou-sama asks him to become a hero he plays along and agrees. But lo and behold he actually gets transformed into a superhero!

title: Majin Tantei Nōgami Neuro
mu_alt_titles: โนงามิ นิวโร ปีศาจนับสือเขมือบปริศนา (SIC)
mu_description:
The Demon Neuro has a raging hunger for 'mysteries.' Being dissatisfied with his current regime in hell, he’s come into the mortal realm in order to satiate his ever-growing appetite. The murder case of a young girl’s father seems to be sufficiently enticing for the Demon’s needs but what else might happen between these two? Find out in this disturbingly good murder-mystery series.

Note: The pilot one-shot is only included in the bunko version. Volume 23 contains Rikon Choutei (Divorce Conciliation/離婚調停).
trivia: Majin Tantei Nōgami Neuro features a demon from hell who feeds on mysteries.

title: Mieru Hito
mu_alt_titles: เมียวจิน ทูตส่งวิญญาณ (SIC)
mu_description: Myoujin is a guide for spirits. Unlike most people, he can see ghosts, ghosts who live and wander in the same world we do. But he's got something even more special up his sleeve: he can touch them. Okegawa Himeno is an ordinary 16 year-old girl studying in Tokyo. But now she's become Myoujin's housemate, infact, he's her landlord. After a close brush with death herself, Himeno becomes able to see the walking dead herself. At least now she's able to meet her neighbours.

title: MP0
mu_alt_titles: Snow in the Dark 叶 恭弘短編集Ⅲ
スノウ　イン　ザ　ダーク
桐野佐亜子と仲間たち
mu_description:
Collection of 4 oneshots:

1. MP0 - Weekly Shounen Jump 3-4#, 2005  
The oneshot that will lead to Mx0. The names are different but the contents are the same.

2. Shi Monkey (し〜もんき〜) - Weekly Shounen Jump Zoukan: Akamaru Jump Summer, 2004

 A boy has come to a deserted island to meet his scientist father who is working on a top-secret experiment. There he meets a beautiful girl who knows him, but he doesn't know her.

3. Snow in the Dark - Weekly Shounen Jump Zoukan: Akamaru Jump Winter, 2004  
 A one-shot fairy tale which shares many elements of the traditional story of Snow White but is certainly unique and complex enough that it is more than just a reinterpretation.

4. Kirino Sako to Nakamatachi (桐野佐亜子と仲間たち) - Weekly Shounen Jump 19-20#, 2004  
Original work: Taisuke Ninohara. With criminals who abuse the supernatural power "Revelation", the story of a private office that confronts this
trivia: MP0 is a one-shot manga that was published in Weekly Shonen Jump in 2005.
MP0 shares the same content as the later, full series titled Mx0.
MP0 is one of four one-shot manga collected together.

title: Suberu o Itowazu
mu_alt_titles: 森田まさのり短編集 スベルヲイトワズ
mu_description:
A collection of seven short stories and a collection of color pages from [Rokudenashi Blues](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=1134) from Morita Masanori's career.

- Suberu wo Itowazu (Setting Up to Fail)  
A story of two stand-up comedians preparing to participate in a school festival.

- [Bachi-Atari Rock](http://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=60397).

- Let's Spend The Night Together  
The story of Tatsumi Shindo, a wrestler coming from a Yakuza family. While he has no interest of having the life of a Yakuza, Tatsumi is stuck having his matches watch by his father and the rest of the yakuza and scaring his opponents. He hopes to be able to prove himself as a strong wrestler and not someone whose family intimidates the opponent.

- Jumpin' Jack Flash

- Synchronicity

- Mysterious Kid

- Stay Here
trivia: Suberu o Itowazu is a collection of short stories and color pages by Masanori Morita.
Suberu o Itowazu includes a story titled "Let's Spend The Night Together" about a wrestler from a Yakuza family.
Suberu o Itowazu features stories like "Suberu wo Itowazu (Setting Up to Fail)" and "Bachi-Atari Rock".

title: Zan
mu_description:
A samurai manga about a boy named Zan. Zan's father was a legendary swordsman who used a sword which had no blade (think Sakabatou from Ruroken). Zan's father died one day, and ever since, Zan has wanted to follow in his fathers footsteps.

The manga starts off with Zan being transfered to a new high school in his second year. When pushed, Zan somehow becomes super strong and has incredible sword technique that allows him to beat his enemies.

title: Gag Manga Biyori
mu_alt_titles: 増田こうすけ劇場 ギャグマンガ日和
mu_description: Gyagu Manga Biyori is hyperactive, random, and nonsensical, revolving around various plots and characters throughout the series.
trivia: Gag Manga Biyori originated as a one-shot before becoming a serialized manga.
Gag Manga Biyori has had multiple anime adaptations across different seasons.
Gag Manga Biyori often features parodies of historical figures and events.

title: Usagi to Kame to Strike
mu_description:
This is about a lazy baseball player, Taro, and a very serious baseball player, Takami, who want to make it to the top. They cross paths on a bus that crashes. Takami dies and Taro lives. Taro visits Takami's grave and sees Takami's ghost. His ghost tells Taro to "switch" with him and take him to the koshien to fulfil his dream.

Included in this manga are three unrelated short stories:

-  *Usagi to Kame to Strike*

- *Live Alive*

- *Cross Beat*
trivia: Usagi to Kame to Strike features a plot device where a deceased baseball player's ghost compels the protagonist to fulfill his Koshien dream.
Usagi to Kame to Strike contains two other unrelated short stories titled *Live Alive* and *Cross Beat*.
Usagi to Kame to Strike centers on the theme of baseball, incorporating elements of drama, the supernatural, and pursuing dreams.

title: Beshari Gurashi
mu_description: Keisuke Agatsuma, is a high school student with a great sense of comedy. A student named Jun Tsujimoto transfers to his school. Both share ideas and form a plan to make a stand-up comedian duo. They aim to become pro together, despite the many hardships they will face.

title: Nazo no Murasame-kun
mu_description: Murasame Kunai is just your average high school boy…except for the fact that he’s a ninja and his father is a spy for the Secret Service. Will Kunai be able to keep this a secret in order to save the lives of his loved ones…and his own?
trivia: Nazo no Murasame-kun features a protagonist named Murasame Kunai, a ninja trying to live a normal high school life.
Nazo no Murasame-kun involves Kunai's struggle to conceal his ninja identity and his father's secret agent profession.

title: Tsugihagi Hyōryū Sakka
mu_description: Kibino Makibi is a young Hyoryu Sakka (wandering writer) who seeks to get his Hyoryuroku (wanderer's log) published. Hyoryu Sakka are some kind of explorators going on expedition to unknown places and unknown events in the world, to fill up the black spots of the world. Armed with an umbrella he meets up with Mitsune, the "editor-in-chief" of Sogano Publications. Their journey begins...
trivia: Tsugihagi Hyōryū Sakka features a protagonist named Kibino Makibi who is a Hyoryu Sakka (wandering writer).
Tsugihagi Hyōryū Sakka revolves around the concept of exploring unknown places and events to fill in the world's "black spots".
Tsugihagi Hyōryū Sakka involves Kibino Makibi's aim to get his Hyoryuroku (wanderer's log) published with the help of Mitsune.

title: Maison du Penguin
mu_alt_titles: メイソンヅペングイン
メゾン・ド・ペンギン

title: Corrector M&Y
mu_description:
From MangaHelpers:

Sakuraba Kota is a pretty ordinary student and a member of the news club. One day, while he's looking into some recent incidents for his club, he runs into an enormous, dangerous creature. He learns that it is one of the powerful beasts that causes disasters and grows by eating the souls of the people they attack. Luckily, he is rescued by two "Contractors," people who form a contract to use one of the 4 god powers: Fire, Water, Wind and Earth. The two contractors are Suzaku Mikoto, a hotheaded fire wielder of an established contractor family, and Byakko Yuna, a pretty female wind wielder who follows Mikoto.

The next day, he learns he hasn't seen the last of Mikoto and Yuna-- Mikoto is a new transfer student in his class, and Yuna is his class's new assistant teacher. Life is about to get more dangerous and exciting as Kota finds himself caught up in Mikoto and Yuna's fight to protect people from these dangerous beasts! [tethysdust]
trivia: Corrector M&Y features protagonists who are part of a news club.
Corrector M&Y centers around characters who form contracts to wield the powers of fire, water, wind, and earth.
Corrector M&Y involves characters named Suzaku Mikoto and Byakko Yuna who are associated with fire and wind powers respectively.

title: Hand's
mu_description: Daigo wants to be a hero, but his father, once the ace of the Japanese team in handball, is a bum that loses all of their money in gambling. He goes to a coach and asks him to take care of his son, because he got into a debt and is running from the yakuza. The coach thinks he's an outstanding talent that has been given to him to coach, and he sends his daughter to pick him. Daigo then ends up living with them.
trivia: Hand's features a protagonist named Daigo whose father was a former handball ace turned gambler.
Hand's centers on the sport of handball, with Daigo being recognized as a talented player.
Hand's involves Daigo living with his new coach and the coach's daughter after his father flees.

title: To Love-Ru
mu_alt_titles: วุ่นรักยัยต่างดาว
mu_description:
From Seven Seas:  
Yuuki Rito is your average high school student - awkward, shy, and hopeless when it comes to confessing his feelings to the girl of his dreams. But one day, an alien princess on the run suddenly appears in his bathtub. When Rito finds himself engaged to the beautiful Lala after a misunderstanding, he becomes embroiled in the chaos of extraterrestrial politics, rival alien suitors, and harem hilarity. The story continues in To Love Ru Darkness, when Lala’s younger sister Momo begins her own machinations to marry Rito but it can only happen if he is coronated as king of their interstellar empire, which would allow him to marry as many women as he wants.
categories: Love Interests Who Don't Get Along
trivia: To Love-Ru features a protagonist, Yuuki Rito, who becomes engaged to an alien princess named Lala due to a misunderstanding.
To Love-Ru incorporates elements of extraterrestrial politics and rival alien suitors into its harem comedy.
To Love-Ru Darkness continues the story, focusing on Lala's younger sister Momo's plans for Rito to become king and marry multiple women.

title: M×0
mu_description:
During a flashback, an interviewer inquires Kuzumi Taiga, a prospective student for Seinagi Private High School, on what he would do if he could use magic, during his entrance interview. He replies, "take over the world", with an outburst of laughter, from an attractive girl, following his answer.  
After the entrance exam, the school rejects his application; although he recalls almost nothing after this event, he does recall the girl, and believes the cause of his school of choice rejecting his application involves her.  
Wandering around outside of the school the next day, Kuzumi tries to enter, but an invisible barrier blocks him. A teacher, Mr. Hiiragi, confuses Kuzumi for a student of the school ditching class and pulls Kuzumi into the school through the barrier.  
Seinagi Private High School is actually a magic school and Mr. Hiiragi has just accidentally pulled Kuzumi, a teenager with no magical skill, through the barrier into this school.
trivia: M×0 features a protagonist who accidentally gains access to a magic school despite lacking any magical ability.
M×0 revolves around Seinagi Private High School, a hidden institution dedicated to magic.
M×0 begins with Kuzumi Taiga's rejection from Seinagi Private High School and his accidental entry into it.

title: Over Time
mu_description:
This is about a lazy baseball player, Taro, and a very serious baseball player, Takami, who want to make it to the top. They cross paths on a bus that crashes. Takami dies and Taro lives. Taro visits Takami's grave and sees Takami's ghost. His ghost tells Taro to "switch" with him and take him to the koshien to fulfil his dream.

Included in this manga are three unrelated short stories:

-  *Usagi to Kame to Strike*

- *Live Alive*

- *Cross Beat*
trivia: Over Time features a ghost who wants the protagonist to fulfill his baseball dream.
Over Time includes three unrelated short stories: *Usagi to Kame to Strike*, *Live Alive*, and *Cross Beat*.
Over Time centers around a lazy baseball player who survives a bus crash and inherits the dream of a deceased, serious player.

title: Sket Dance
mu_alt_titles: Sket Dance - Quái kiệt học đường
สเก็ต ดานซ์
mu_description:
The hilarious misadventures of the "Sket Dan" a couple of high schoolers who help out people as part of their club activity: Himeko the hot-headed ex-delinquent with a soft spot for cute things and a taste for strange food. Switch the brainy otaku who only talks via a computerized speech application. Bossun the atypical leader of this looney bunch, with the amazing power to concentrate very hard.

Note: Won the 55th annual Shogakukan Manga Award for best Shounen manga in 2009.
trivia: Sket Dance features a club called "Sket Dan" that assists students with their problems.
Sket Dance won the 55th Shogakukan Manga Award for Best Shonen Manga in 2009.

title: Hitomi no Catoblepas
mu_description: The story of a guy named Tokio, who's a descendant of a legendary family of youma (demon) fighters. He has the ability to freeze time because of the youma he has in his eye, Catoblepas. One day, he encounters a girl who became a target of a demon. Tokio, with his eye, will try to prevent the girl from becoming another victim of a string of mysterious events that have occured in the town as of late. Little does the girl know that Tokio is her next door neighbour.

title: Blue Dragon Ral Ω Grad
mu_alt_titles: BLUE　DRAGON　ラル・グラド
ブルードラゴン ラルΩグラド
mu_description: In the days of war, a baby fused together with a "shadow" called Blue Dragon, a legend among the "shadows". Because of that, he was locked in darkness from birth until recently, 15 years later, to prevent his shadow from activating. From the beginning, the only person he knew was his tutor who would come see him everyday. But "shadows" have begun to run rampant as they escape from "Noir" through living beings. Humans call for the release of Blue Dragon in order to help mankind; thus their journey begins to seal the "shadows" along with the strongest: their queen.
trivia: Blue Dragon Ral Ω Grad features a protagonist fused with a shadow named Blue Dragon.
Blue Dragon Ral Ω Grad centers around sealing shadows that are escaping from "Noir".
Blue Dragon Ral Ω Grad sees the protagonist released after 15 years to combat the shadow threat.

title: Jumbor Barutronica
mu_alt_titles: ユンボル 「荒野の床暖房」
mu_description:
By Windara:

It was 3002, and the human civilization had crumbled and rebuilt itself again and again over the thousand years, despite the destruction and challenge brought by the harsh nature.

In this era of constant war against nature and havoc, construction teams were the star of economy system, the conquering force as well as a weapon themselves, because heavy robots were used in construction works to speed up efficiency.

Jumbor was the leader of a famous construction team of a little country with a cute princess. One day, as their group was about to start a reconstruction work of a tunnel which was destroyed by an earthquake, a much more powerful construction team arrived and claimed the land in no time, killing Jumbor who tried to protect his teammates against the cruel opponents...

Jumbor woke up in 3007, finding himself revived in his own clone body (memory transplanted) which has a physical age of 5 years old, and in addition to that, his body was partly mechanized. His robot arms are linked up to and directly controlled by his brain's signals. He was told that the country had gone and the princess and the king disappeared, and he discovered that his mechanized body is very powerful. He was also told he was 'last of the series'.

The series was canceled after ten issues and released in one volume. The two oneshots under the title of "Jumbor" and "Jumbor - The Desert With a Floor Heater"  from Ultra Jump connect with the original Jyuki Ningen Jumbor storyline. In 2010, a reboot of the original series began in Ultra Jump as "Jumbor" with writer Hiromasa Mikami.
trivia: Jumbor Barutronica was canceled after only ten issues and compiled into a single volume.
Jumbor Barutronica features a protagonist revived as a partially mechanized clone with robot arms controlled by brain signals.
Jumbor Barutronica shares continuity with two earlier oneshots titled "Jumbor" and "Jumbor - The Desert With a Floor Heater" which were released in Ultra Jump magazine.

title: Cross Epoch
mu_description: Cross Epoch is a one-shot Japanese manga collaboration by Akira Toriyama and Eiichiro Oda. It is a crossover between their respective manga Dragon Ball and One Piece.
trivia: Cross Epoch  features characters from both Dragon Ball and One Piece in a single narrative.
Cross Epoch  is a one-shot manga, indicating it's a standalone story with no sequels.
Cross Epoch  is a collaborative work, showcasing the artistic styles of Akira Toriyama and Eiichiro Oda.

title: Samurai Usagi
mu_description:
The main character Udagawa Gosuke has received his father's dojo, mainly because his father and older brother were made to commit hara-kiri. He wasn't really supposed to get it simply because he's a second son. But due to the way his pops and brother died, he doesn't have a whole lot of self confidence, so he practices fencing day-by-day at a nearby dojo. However, because the people at that dojo are asses, he soon tries to invent a dojo and a style for people who just enjoy it.

However what really sets this aside from most shounen is that the main male and female characters are actually married. (At age 15 no less!)

The girl Utagawa Shino is the younger sister of his senpai, and is a bit...weird, to say the least. She makes rabbit masks to help bring in a bit of money, although to say that she's obsessed with rabbits would be an understatement. She claims it's because "the rabbits will someday reach the moon." When Gosuke invents his new dojo, he decides to make a style of swordsmanship known as "Rabbit Style Fencing."
trivia: Samurai Usagi features a protagonist, Gosuke, who inherits his father's dojo due to tragic circumstances involving hara-kiri.
Samurai Usagi deviates from typical shonen tropes by featuring a married main couple, Gosuke and Shino, who are both 15 years old.
Samurai Usagi incorporates a "Rabbit Style Fencing" created by Gosuke, inspired by Shino's obsession with rabbits.

title: Asklepios
mu_description: An order has been sent out to hunt down Asklepios, a Greek demon god of medicine, whom the Church believes is practicing unorthodox methods. A member of armed forces group assigned to this mission by the name of Luca encounters two kids who saved him when he was injured during a fight. Who are these kids, and can they help out Luca with his personal reason for doing this assignment?

title: Koi no Kami-sama
mu_alt_titles: 恋の神様 古味直志短編集
mu_description:
A collection of one-shots publlished between 2007-2008 published on various magazines and the Nisekoi pilot chapter: 

1. Island (2007, Akamaru Jump)  
For the last 400 years, an island has been completely surrounded by walls, isolated from the rest of the world. Aira and Marue have always dreamed of voyaging outside the walls, where lies a devastating truth unbeknownst to them.

2. Koi no Kami-sama (2007, Weekly Shonen Jump)  
Tsuchibe Taichi, a boy who loves shoujo manga and believes in love above all else, ironically has the worst luck in love. His latest attempt in love is at the new transfer student, but a strange otherworldly force seems to be repelling him from her.

3. Williams (2007, Weekly Shonen Jump)  
William is a young boy who idolizes Aradoff, a character from a popular novel which told Aradoff's adventures, and always dreams of having a grand adventure on his own. William's meeting with the novel author finally puts him on an adventure to prove that the novel is not merely a fiction. 

4. Personant (2008, Jump SQ)  
In the year 3333, everyone wears personants, technologically advanced masks, to maintain equality and peace, because they eliminate the "differences" in people that lead to discrimination and conflict. It has been 100 years since the government implemented this "personant system," so society has adapted. Yet one man exists as the only one in the world without a personant: the wanted criminal Damore! 

5. Apple (2009, Weekly Shounen Jump)  
The main character (the blond ponytailed guy - yeah, guy) is Aramiya Satoshi, whose main ability is shape-shifting into any animal... though at some point he has plants growing out of him, so he is able shape-shift into any living thing. I'm not sure if he was naturally born that way or if he was a biological experiment. Anyway, he's a pretty easy-going guy who just wants to be left alone to enjoy his solitary life in the middle of a junkyard, but apparently some army or another is always after him because of his ability. Luckily, he is able to fight off entire tank battalions before breakfast. 

6. Nisekoi (pilot chapter - 2011, Jump Next!)
trivia: Koi no Kami-sama is a collection of one-shot manga by the creator of Nisekoi.
Koi no Kami-sama includes the one-shot "Koi no Kami-sama," focusing on a boy with terrible luck in love.
Koi no Kami-sama was published in Weekly Shonen Jump in 2007.

title: Boku no Watashi no Yusha Gaku
mu_alt_titles: Boku no Watashi no Yusha Gaku
ぼくのわたしの勇者学
mu_description:
It opens when a mysterious strangely dressed person who the kids mistake as a new transfer student enters a peaceful classroom. Much to their surprise he is their new homeroom teacher, among other things…

— By the author of *[Saiki Kusuo no Ψ Nan](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=78019)*
trivia: Boku no Watashi no Yusha Gaku is created by the same author as Saiki Kusuo no Ψ Nan.
Boku no Watashi no Yusha Gaku features a new homeroom teacher who is strangely dressed.
Boku no Watashi no Yusha Gaku begins with the arrival of a mysterious individual mistaken for a transfer student.

title: Belmonde Le VisiteuR
mu_description:
The story takes places in 17th century, France. Belmondo, a son of a noble father and a deceased witch mother, was born and raised in a cloister's basement. He is the master of an underground prison and has the rights to use any means to bring out confessions from his prisoners, namely by using "torture". With his eye, he is able to see through them... That is, if they do not comply to his questions.

[Note : the name 'Belmondo' is taken from a very famous French actor, Jean-Paul Belmondo]
trivia: Belmonde Le VisiteuR is set in 17th century France.

title: Nurarihyon no Mago
mu_alt_titles: Nura - A ascensão do clã das sombras
Nura: Rise of the Yokai Clan
นูระ หลานจอมภูติ
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Rikuo grew up in a house full of yokai, so he always thought they were cool. But the kids in his class talk about yokai like they're bad! When his grandfather announces Rikuo as his chosen heir to run the Nura clan, Rikuo is torn between his human nature and his duties as a yokai. The rest of the clan's not so crazy about a wimpy part-human as their ruler, particularly Gagoze, a high-ranking yokai who would rather eat a human than be ruled by one.
categories: Abe no Seimei or a Relative
trivia: Nurarihyon no Mago features the Nura clan, a group of yokai.
Nurarihyon no Mago involves Rikuo inheriting the leadership role from his grandfather.

title: Muddy
mu_description: Clay, a child prodigy, was hired at the age of 14 to become a professor to make chimeras, creatures made with a fusion of various materials.  However, after he was hired, he was unable to meet the expectations of the company that hired him and was fired.  He comes upon an abandoned research facility and creates a human child chimera and names him Muddy.  Together, they will go out into the world and find out what Muddy is capable of.

title: Rosario to Vampire
mu_alt_titles: ロザリオとバンパイア
mu_description:
The story revolves around Tsukune Aono, a boy who accidentally gets enrolled in a school inhabited by monsters and demons. He quickly befriends Moka Akashiya, a vampire who soon develops an obsession with his blood, and later meets other girls who soon take a romantic liking to him.

**Official English Release:**  
[Manga Plus](https://mangaplus.shueisha.co.jp/titles/100022), [Viz](https://www.viz.com/rosario-vampire)

title: Hatsukoi Limited
mu_description: A series of related stories about (a lot of) middle and high school students as they discover their *hatsukoi* (first love).
categories: Female Lead Falls in Love First
Love Interests Who Don't Get Along
Male Lead Falls in Love First
trivia: Hatsukoi Limited focuses on the theme of first love experiences among a large ensemble cast.
Hatsukoi Limited features interconnected stories rather than a single overarching narrative.
Hatsukoi Limited depicts both middle and high school students navigating their initial romances.

title: Williams
mu_alt_titles: 恋の神様 古味直志短編集
