trivia: Williams is a one-shot manga featured in Weekly Shonen Jump in 2007.
Williams centers on a boy named William who embarks on an adventure inspired by a novel.

title: Psyren
mu_description:
From Viz:  
"Save me!" Those were Sakurako Amamiya's last words to her friend Ageha Yoshina before she mysteriously went missing. Now Ageha's on a quest to find her. He's convinced that the mythical Psyren Secret Society has something to do with the recent rash of disappearances. And now he seems to be caught up as a player in their very deadly game.
trivia: Psyren revolves around a deadly game played by the mythical Psyren Secret Society.
Psyren features a protagonist named Ageha Yoshina who is searching for his missing friend, Sakurako Amamiya.

title: K.O.Sen
mu_description: This manga deals with the history of a teenager, Tobi Shima Sen, who lost his father and lives with his mother. He is a scrapper but his mother has no authority over him. In order to educate him, she decides to send him to a kickboxing coach during the holidays/vacation.

title: Urōboe Uroboros!
mu_alt_titles: うろおぼえウロボロス!
うろおぼえウロボロス！
mu_description: What's a guy to do when a militant girl demands he date her little sister? Crazy right? Well, it's exactly what happens to transfer student Kakizaki Kokera. The Harimoto Sisters have a strange love-hate relationship he just can't help but get dragged into. And what's more, there's a strange town legend about a middle schooler who cleaned up the town with overwhelming violence five years ago called Urooboe Uroboros (Half-Remembered Uroboros).

title: Obake Life
mu_description: A girl who can see spirits opened up a manga and read "Those who read to this point in my manga will die without fail on the same day". Terrified, she tries to break her curse, with a jumpy spirit who wants to marry her...?
categories: Male Lead Falls in Love First

title: Q Bu!!
mu_description:
An amazing high-school soccer player, Amagai Rihito, is making his debut! He intended to enter a high school famed across Japan for its elite soccer team, but a little mix-up with the school name has left him at a school with an incredibly weak team. After the initial shock of discovering this, Rihito decides that he's willing to work to help his weak team become the best in Japan. The only problem is the rest of the existing team is cold and unenthusiastic. Will his challenge to take on the whole team single-handedly break them out of their apathy?

Includes the story *Q Bu!!* in vol.2. and *Dodge Ball* in vol.3.
trivia: Q Bu!! features a protagonist, Amagai Rihito, who mistakenly enrolls in a weak soccer school.
Q Bu!! is included in volume 2 along with another story.

title: Bari Haken
mu_description: This is a story about an otaku that turns out to be the leader of a bunch of delinquents, but he's hiding his true self. His goal, get a girlfriend who resembles his anime characters.

title: Double Arts
mu_description:
A boy and a girl are forced to join hands for all eternity!?  
In a land ravaged by an epidemic known as "Troy", the only people with healing arts capable of stopping the seizures caused by the disease are the Sisters. Although they have a high resistance to the disease, they are searching for a person who is truly immune, so that they can find a cure. The main character is Sister Elraine, one of the Sisters who becomes infected with Troy. But, when she touches Kiri, a seemingly ordinary boy, her seizures stop. Could he be the one!?

In volume 1 is included the oneshot *Island*:

A story that takes place on the day Aira turned 14, and learned the devastating truth about the island she lives on, which is completely surrounded by a huge wall...
trivia: Double Arts features a deadly epidemic called "Troy" that causes seizures.
Double Arts includes a one-shot manga titled *Island* about a girl who discovers a secret about her walled-off island home.

title: Dogashi Kaden!
mu_description: Haruyoshi, who has always been stuck as a benchwarmer, plans to start fresh at his new school. Luckily, Haruyoshi runs, literally, into the basketball club manager, Hadzuki, who sees potential in him. However, things won't be a smooth sailing from there.

title: Room 303
mu_description: Yukimaru and his friends investigate the Shiroyashiki as they look for their missing friends and run into the strange Room 303.

title: Hiroshi Kaizuka (Dokonjō Gaeru)
mu_description: While frog Pyonkichi is hopping in an empty lot in Nerima, Tokyo's Shakujii Park, middle schooler Hiroshi trips over a rock and squashes him. However, Pyonkichi is reborn as an imprint on the front of Hiroshi's shirt and now gives him advice and commentary on his life.
trivia: Hiroshi Kaizuka (Dokonjō Gaeru) features a frog named Pyonkichi who lives imprinted on the main character's shirt.
Hiroshi Kaizuka (Dokonjō Gaeru) takes place in Shakujii Park, Nerima, Tokyo.
Hiroshi Kaizuka (Dokonjō Gaeru) involves Pyonkichi providing advice and commentary on Hiroshi's life.

title: Arale Norimaki (Dr. Slump)
mu_alt_titles: Dr. Slump อาราเร่จัง
mu_description:
From Viz:  
When goofy inventor Senbei Norimaki creates a precocious robot named Arale, his masterpiece turns out to be more than he bargained for!

This series helped launch Toriyama's career and was awarded the Shogakukan Manga Award for shounen and shoujo manga in 1982.
trivia: Arale Norimaki (Dr. Slump) helped launch Akira Toriyama's manga career.
Arale Norimaki (Dr. Slump) features a robot girl named Arale created by Senbei Norimaki.
Arale Norimaki (Dr. Slump) won the Shogakukan Manga Award in 1982.

title: Hanamichi Sakuragi (Slam Dunk)
mu_alt_titles: スラムダンク あれから10日後ー
mu_description:
From VIZ:  
Winning isn't everything in the game of basketball, but who wants to come in second? It takes dedication and discipline to be the best, and the Shohoku High hoops team wants to be just that. They have one last year to make their captain's dream of reaching the finals come true--will they do it? Takehiko Inoue's legendary beloved basketball manga is finally here and the tale of a lifetime is in your hands.  
Hanamichi Sakuragi's got no game with girls—none at all! It doesn't help that he's known for throwing down at a moment's notice and always coming out on top. A hopeless bruiser, he's been rejected by 50 girls in a row! All that changes when he meets the girl of his dreams, Haruko, and she's actually not afraid of him! When she introduces him to the game of basketball, his life is changed forever.

To commemorate the 100 Million sales of the series, a one-shot called “10 Days After” was drawn by the author in a classroom at Kanagawa Prefectural Misaki High School in December 2004. This epilogue later published in a special documentary book and Switch magazine in 2005.

Notes: Received the 40th Shogakukan Manga Award for shounen in 1995.
trivia: Hanamichi Sakuragi (Slam Dunk) received the 40th Shogakukan Manga Award for shonen in 1995.
Hanamichi Sakuragi (Slam Dunk) achieved 100 million copies in circulation, commemorated by a one-shot epilogue titled "10 Days After".
Hanamichi Sakuragi (Slam Dunk) centers on a high school basketball team aiming to reach the national finals.

title: Kankichi Ryotsu (Kochikame)
mu_alt_titles: In Katsushika Ward in Front of Kameari Park There is a Police Box
This Is the Police Station in Front of Kameari Park in Katsushika Ward
こちら葛飾区亀有公園前派出所
mu_description:
The typical Kochikame plot involves Ryo-san coming up with a money-making scheme by inventing a new gadget or capitalizing on a fad, achieving great success, calling on Nakagawa's help as things turn sour, and finally losing it all as the fad runs out of steam or out of control. While the plots are gag-driven, much of the humor comes from the juxtaposition of mundane characters with the bizarrely incongruous (Nakagawa's wealth, Maria's appeal, everyone's lack of actual police work), most of which is never explained or rationalized in the slightest.

Note: Won the Seiun Award for Best Comic in 2017.
trivia: Kankichi Ryotsu (Kochikame) won the Seiun Award for Best Comic in 2017.
Kankichi Ryotsu (Kochikame) features plots centered on Ryo-san's often unsuccessful money-making schemes.

title: Pharaoh Atem (Yu-Gi-Oh!)
mu_alt_titles: เกมกลคนอัจฉริยะ (SIC)
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Sitting by himself in the back of the class, 10th-grader Yugi always had his head in some game--until he solved the Millennium Puzzle, an Egyptian artifact containing a powerful spirit from the age of the pharaohs. Awakened after three thousand years, the King of Games possesses Yugi, recklessly challenging bullies and evildoers to the Shadow Games, where the stakes are high and even the most ordinary bet may result in weirdness and danger beyond belief. Let the games begin.

This section of the original [Yu-Gi-Oh!](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=68749871234) series and covers the beginning of the series where the card game wasn't the main focus. Continues in [Yu-Gi-Oh! Duelist](https://www.mangaupdates.com/series.html?id=46214085769).
trivia: Pharaoh Atem (Yu-Gi-Oh!) precedes Yu-Gi-Oh! Duelist in the manga's narrative timeline.
Pharaoh Atem (Yu-Gi-Oh!) focuses on Shadow Games with high stakes beyond the card game.
Pharaoh Atem (Yu-Gi-Oh!) features Yugi awakening a powerful ancient Egyptian spirit.

title: Ryoma Echizen (Prince of Tennis)
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Ryoma Echizen just joined the Seishun Academy's tennis team, which is known for being one of the most competitive teams in Japan. Its members are incredibly talented, gifted, and athletic. With rigorous and extremely intense practices, the upperclassmen of the team expect the very best from themselves and they expect even more from the new members of the team. While most of the freshmen are on pins and needles hoping they won't get cut from the team, Ryoma Echizen is confident, cool, and collected. Some might even say he's cocky, but at least he's got the skills to back up his attitude. With his virtually unreturnable "twist serve," Ryoma is sure to make the starting team.   
Join Ryoma and the other first years, as they train hard, make friends, and try to find a place for themselves on the team. And meet Ryoma's cute but chronically shy classmate Sakuno Ryuzaki. She's got a big crush on Ryoma, but will he ever notice her? Ryoma Echizen is the Prince of Tennis. He may be ready for the Seishun Academy tennis team, but are they ready for him?
trivia: Ryoma Echizen (Prince of Tennis) is a series where the protagonist is supremely confident in his tennis abilities.
Ryoma Echizen (Prince of Tennis) follows Ryoma's journey to find his place on Seishun Academy's competitive tennis team.
Ryoma Echizen (Prince of Tennis) features Sakuno Ryuzaki, a classmate with a crush on Ryoma.

title: FC Barcelona Monogatari
mu_description:
An ode to one of the most famous Spanish Football Soccer Teams, FC Barcelona. A one shot by the author of Meister showing us the importance of FC Barcelona's Inferior Forces and Barcelona's Motto. Starring current Soccer Idols like Bojan and Lionel Messi!

A One shot that a FC Barcelona fan should not miss!!
trivia: FC Barcelona Monogatari is a one-shot manga by the author of Meister.
FC Barcelona Monogatari features appearances by real-life FC Barcelona players, including Bojan and Lionel Messi.
FC Barcelona Monogatari highlights the significance of FC Barcelona's youth academy ("Inferior Forces") and the club's motto.

title: Bakuman
mu_alt_titles: Bakuman - Giấc mơ họa sĩ truyện tranh
วัยซนคนการ์ตูน
爆漫-夢與現實 Baku Man
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Average student Moritaka Mashiro enjoys drawing for fun. When his classmate and aspiring writer Akito Takagi discovers his talent, he begs Moritaka to team up with him as a manga-creating duo. But what exactly does it take to make it in the manga-publishing world?

[Read for free on Manga Plus](https://mangaplus.shueisha.co.jp/titles/100002)

Note: Nominated for the 3rd Manga Taisho Award (2010).
categories: Emulating A Person Whom One Admires
Female Lead Falls in Love First
trivia: Bakuman features two protagonists, an artist and a writer, aiming to succeed in the manga industry.
Bakuman was nominated for the 3rd Manga Taisho Award in 2010.
Bakuman follows the process of creating manga for Shonen Jump magazine.

title: Beelzebub
mu_alt_titles: เด็กพันธุ์นรกสั่งลุย
べるぜバブ 番外編
mu_description:
Ishiyama High is a school populated entirely by delinquents, where nonstop violence and lawlessness are the norm. However, there is one universally acknowledged rule—don't cross first year student Tatsumi Oga, Ishiyama's most vicious fighter.  
One day, Oga is by a riverbed when he encounters a man floating down the river. After being retrieved by Oga, the man splits down the middle to reveal a baby, which crawls onto Oga's back and immediately forms an attachment to him. Though he doesn't know it yet, this baby is named Kaiser de Emperana Beelzebub IV, or "Baby Beel" for short—the son of the Demon Lord!  
As if finding the future Lord of the Underworld isn't enough, Oga is also confronted by Hildegard, Beel's demon maid who insists he take responsibility as Beel's guardian. Together they attempt to raise Baby Beel—although surrounded by juvenile delinquents and demonic powers, the two of them may be in for more of a challenge than they can imagine.
trivia: Beelzebub revolves around the unlikely guardianship of Tatsumi Oga over Baby Beel, the son of the Demon Lord.
Beelzebub features Hildegard, a demon maid tasked with ensuring Oga takes responsibility for Baby Beel.

title: Inumarudashii
mu_description: The kindergartener hero Inumaru's chaotic life as he causes lively and funny incidents in this gag manga. Inumaru is just a little strange, with his deep knowledge of celebrity and Shonen Jump gossip, and his stubborn policy of not wearing pants. His teacher Tamako is given the run around everyday! This popular serial is around 9 pages each week, sometimes with just a little color thrown in!!
trivia: Inumarudashii is a gag manga centered around a kindergartener named Inumaru and his teacher Tamako.

title: Chagecha
mu_description: From all over Japan, Yankee Boys (hoodlums) full of dreams and ambition gather in Gure Tokyo. Then Chagecha appears with his unorthodox "Yanki," and changes everything!!

title: Meister
mu_description: Chiba Prefectural Satomi High School has a very strange soccer team. Despite being made up of complete misfit first years, they managed to get 4th place in the national high school championship. From shut-ins to Yankees, most of the team members are not what you would call normal. This story begins at start of the 2nd for all the original team members, when they introduce yet another misfit into their group, a very tall 1st year who is terrible at head butting the ball!

title: Kuroko's Basketball
mu_alt_titles: คุโรโกะนายจืดพลิกสังเวียนบาส (NED)
mu_description:
Kuroko Tetsuya doesn't stand out much. In fact, he's so plain that most people never even notice he's around. Though he's pretty much the same on the basketball court, that's where this unobtrusiveness gives him an unexpected edge: one that lets him execute awesome moves without his opponents noticing! Once dubbed "The Phantom Sixth Man" of a legendary middle school team known as the Generation of Miracles, Kuroko enters Seirin High School, a brand new private school with a nascent basketball club, with only one goal in mind: to defeat the members of his old team and prove that "Kuroko's Way" is superior to the Generation of Miracles'.

[Read for FREE on Manga Plus](https://mangaplus.shueisha.co.jp/titles/100137)
trivia: Kuroko's Basketball features Kuroko Tetsuya as the protagonist, a former member of the Generation of Miracles known as the "Phantom Sixth Man."
Kuroko's Basketball centers around Kuroko's goal to prove his basketball style is superior to his former teammates from the Generation of Miracles.
Kuroko's Basketball takes place at Seirin High School, a new private school where Kuroko starts his high school basketball journey.

title: Bokke-san
mu_description: Hinomiya is a quiet student who never says anything, but has a supernatural power.  He saved Shijiro Sayu a number of years ago when she was falling, and since then she has considered him a friend.  One day, an unnatural murder occurs, and a little girl escaping the killers runs into Hinomiya and Shijiro, with the supernatural villains not far behind!

title: Trigger Keeper
mu_description: A two-part one-shot created by Daisuke Ashihara. It is the first precursor to the World Trigger manga series.
trivia: Trigger Keeper is a two-part one-shot manga.
Trigger Keeper was created by Daisuke Ashihara.
Trigger Keeper is a precursor to the manga series World Trigger.

title: Medaka Box
mu_description:
Kurokami Medaka, a first year, is elected as Student Council President, and the first thing she does is establish a suggestion box, later dubbed by students the "Medaka Box." Medaka encourages students to submit any problem to the box without hesitation and promises to take on any issue from anyone.  
Since Medaka won the Student Council elections with a staggering 98% of the vote, she ends up as the Council's only member. She asks her childhood friend, Hitoyoshi Zenkichi, for help and he grudgingly agrees, becoming the Student Council's lowest ranking member. Soon Medaka recruits two more people to the Student Council, the former judo club member Akune Kouki as secretary and the current swim club member Kikaijima Mogana, on loan for 300 yen a day, as treasurer.  
Now the Student Council members spend their days solving the problems submitted through the Medaka Box, whether they be hooligans in clubs where they don't belong, girls who need help writing love letters or people who've lost their pets, gradually earning the respect and admiration of the entire school.
trivia: Medaka Box revolves around the Student Council solving problems submitted through the titular "Medaka Box".
Medaka Box features a Student Council where one member is "on loan" for 300 yen a day.

title: Buchikamashi
mu_description: Published in Weekly Shounen Jump #11.

title: Hoopmen
mu_description: Satou Yuuho gets called out by the cute basketball club manager, Koganei Mao. He thinks that it is a love confession, only to find out that it is only to help the basketball club...

title: Blust!
mu_description: Kai has a policy never to use his curry-powered nuclear blasters built in surgically into his arms in the same place twice. But when he finds that he is targeted, and that he has a chance to repay his town's debt, he experiences a deja vu.

title: Neko Wappa!
mu_description: One day, the cat gods of a shrine that is falling out of use find a human baby left outside, all alone. They decide to take in the baby, who they name Tama, and raise her as their own. Now the little girl Tama, who knows very little about humans, is trying to grant the wishes of anyone who visits their little shrine, using the power of the cat gods!

title: Lock On!
mu_description:
Utsuru Sanada is a professional photographer at the age of 17, he can guess the exact 3 sizes of any girl, he can memorize anything he sees, and he can counterattack karate moves (most guys would want these abilities). Why? Because he has superb photographic memory called “Shutter Eye”. He meets Niko Kurihara, the female protagonist, who dislikes men, is a master of martial arts, and is of course beautiful. Utsuru attempts to prove to Niko that he is not the guy she thinks he is so that he can take a picture of her. He starts by investigating Niko’s friend’s date, who appears to be a deceptive guy according to rumors…

Ran as a one-shot in 2009; started serialization in 2010.
trivia: Lock On! features a protagonist with a photographic memory called "Shutter Eye."
Lock On! began serialization in 2010.
Lock On! involves a male protagonist trying to convince a martial arts master to let him photograph her.

title: Anedoki
mu_alt_titles: Anedoki La tata dei tuoi sogni
mu_description:
Ah, the dream of 13! Kouta is our normal everyday boy, living with his fun-loving workaholic father. Lusting after the school idol in his class, playing games with his friends... there's nothing especially noticeable about him. But one day his father has to transfer to Sapporo and then appears a girl who volunteers to be Kouta's live in caretaker. And what a girl!

Everything about her is mysterious: her mysterious incredibly showy body, her mysterious interest in our boy, and her mysterious need to sleep in the same room...

Doki, doki...

title: Kagijin
mu_description:
To be free like a swallow out of its bird cage, that’s what Tsubame sees in his eyes. In the East Asian Desert, #13 Salvage Camp, Tsubame works as a metal scrap collector as he tries to earn enough money to travel on his own, like a free swallow. But one day a girl was found buried inside sand and she has a key hole on her wrist, the symbol of a Kagijin, one who posses demonic powers that can withstand that of an army. The empire who kept her as a slave arrives to retrieve her, however Tsubame refuses to hand her over and promises her that he will free her. How will he do so? And what significance is there to the key that hangs around his monkey's neck? Read and find out!

From the one shot in Akamaru Jump Winter 2009 issue (1/10/09).
trivia: Kagijin originated as a one-shot manga published in the Akamaru Jump Winter 2009 issue.
Kagijin features a protagonist named Tsubame who works as a metal scrap collector in the East Asian Desert.
Kagijin centers around a girl with a keyhole on her wrist, indicating she is a "Kagijin" with demonic powers.

title: Wasshoi! Waji Mania
mu_alt_titles: わっしょい！わじマニア

title: Metallica Metalluca
mu_description: In a world where rare metals drive the economy, "Minea", the people who seek out these metals at the risk of their own life, are highly respected. A strange boy called Ruka has wandered destructively into the failing town of Elza, declaring that his goal is to be a Minea! He ends up under the surveillance of a village girl, Shella, whose little brother is sick from a poison gas accident in the town's now-closed mine. But there may be more to this situation than meets the eye! Will Ruka be able to help his new friends, and maybe one day become a legendary Minea?
trivia: Metallica Metalluca centers around the pursuit of rare metals as a central economic driver.
Metallica Metalluca features a protagonist named Ruka who aspires to become a Minea.
Metallica Metalluca involves a town, Elza, suffering from the effects of a closed mine and a poison gas accident.

title: Hokenshitsu no Shinigami
mu_alt_titles: ฮาเดส มัจจุราชชุดขาว (SIC)
mu_description: Hades-sensei is no ordinary middle school doctor. In fact, many students believe he is a shinigami. His excessive friendliness and eagerness to win his students' affection does little to offset his terrifying appearance. But, fortunately for this middle school, Hades-sensei is an expert at extracting "byouma", disease demons, from possessed students!
trivia: Hokenshitsu no Shinigami features a middle school doctor rumored to be a shinigami due to his terrifying appearance.
Hokenshitsu no Shinigami centers around Hades-sensei extracting "byouma," or disease demons, from possessed students.

title: Kashikoi Inu Rilienthal
mu_alt_titles: 聪明的狗狗莉莉安塔尓
賢い犬リリエンタール
mu_description:
From [Artificial Demons](http://artificialdemons.boards.net/):

In the series, the Hino family picks up their "little brother" from the airport. The "brother" turns out to be Rilienthal, an intelligent dog who speaks Japanese. He is also the target of men in black suit from a mysterious organization. They refer him as RD-1.

title: SWOT
mu_description:
Transfer student Manabizaki Kyou is a swot, a person who spends too much time studying. His dream is to attend Tokyo University and then work for NASA! He will soon discover, however, that the high school he's transferred into, which was once very prestigious, has taken in delinquents from the surrounding schools. Now it is full of violence and gang fights.  
Luckily, Manabizaki has a surprising skill at fighting, particularly when he's defending the peace of his study area. Through this strength he'll find his new friends, a weak boy called Iwashida and a legendary delinquent girl, Hasuno Nene, who makes him feel things that, for the first time in his life, he can't explain...
trivia: SWOT centers around a protagonist whose academic ambitions clash with unexpected gang violence.
SWOT features a 'legendary delinquent girl' character named Hasuno Nene, who complicates the protagonist's focus.
SWOT depicts a prestigious school that has fallen into disrepair and become a haven for delinquents.

title: Futagami Double
mu_description:
Futagami Sousuke, 14 years old, is a normal student, wishing to live a normal life. But everything changes the day he sees a doppelganger of himself in his house.  
Since then, the girl he has a crush on, Amane, will introduce him to another side of his world he had no idea about, and it won't be anymore the dear peaceful days for Futagami.
categories: Male Lead Falls in Love First
trivia: Futagami Double features a protagonist named Futagami Sousuke who encounters his doppelganger.
Futagami Double introduces Amane, a girl who will bring Sousuke into a new world.

title: Sengoku Armors
mu_description: 10 years after the killing of Oda Nobunaga, allegedly through the betrayal of his follower Akechi Mitsuhide, Nobunaga's 16-year-old daughter is being sent to the current ruler of Japan, the cruel Toyotomi Hideyoshi. En route, she is rescued by two mysterious, powerful monks. Her mistrust of their intentions only deepens when she learns that one of them, who calls himself Tenkai, possesses one of the powerful weapons known as "Sodomu." Tenkai's plans will only become clear when his secrets are revealed! Hopefully, he can show Nobunaga's daughter that the power of "Sodomu" can not only be used for evil but rather for good as well!
trivia: Sengoku Armors features "Sodomu," powerful weapons that can be used for both good and evil.
Sengoku Armors is set 10 years after the death of Oda Nobunaga.
Sengoku Armors involves Nobunaga's daughter being rescued by two mysterious monks.

title: Haco
mu_description: After Kusakabe Honoka is diagnosed with an untreatable disease, her father puts her in cold sleep in hopes for the future. When she wakes up, it seems all of civilization has been destroyed. All she has to help her in this future world is Haco, a dog-like robot that was created to protect her. What happened to the world while she was asleep!?

title: Arata no Tsukumogami
mu_description: In the hopes of pleasing his childhood friend and crush, Chiharu, Arata agreed to help her clean out an old warehouse from her grandfather. But what neither of them knew was that the warehouse contained "tsukumogami", ancient objects imbued with life. When Arata accidentally broke the seal on a box containing an artifact that hungered for vengeance against humanity, Chiharu was kidnapped! Now it is up to Arata and the good, loyal artifacts to rescue Chiharu before it is too late!

title: Minds
mu_description: Sergeant Kai takes responsibility for the hardest missions, earning himself the nickname "Iron Heart". Kai claims that he's doing it for promotion but is there something more behind his ambition.....?

title: Light Wing
mu_description:
An amazing high-school soccer player, Amagai Rihito, is making his debut! He intended to enter a high school famed across Japan for its elite soccer team, but a little mix-up with the school name has left him at a school with an incredibly weak team. After the initial shock of discovering this, Rihito decides that he's willing to work to help his weak team become the best in Japan. The only problem is the rest of the existing team is cold and unenthusiastic. Will his challenge to take on the whole team single-handedly break them out of their apathy?

Includes the story *Q Bu!!* in vol.2. and *Dodge Ball* in vol.3.
trivia: Light Wing features a protagonist, Amagai Rihito, who aims to lead a weak high school soccer team to national prominence.
Light Wing includes the one-shot manga *Q Bu!!* in its second volume.
Light Wing sees Amagai Rihito initially intending to join a nationally renowned soccer high school before a mistake lands him elsewhere.

title: Bench!!
mu_description: Transfer student Yamaguchi Tsutomu has just joined the baseball team.  Yamaguchi is overweight and can't run very fast, so the coach places him on the "D" team.  Unlike the "A" team which is has nothing but aces, the "D" team is filled with baseball misfits who don't expect to see any playing time.  Despite this setback, Yamaguchi is determined not to give up his dream of someday becoming a pro second baseman!

title: Moon Walker LTD
mu_alt_titles: 処刑孤島(アバトラズ)の囚人
金鉱採掘人(ガリンペイロ)と光る石
mu_description:
1. *Moon Walker LTD. - Albatross no Shuujin*  
Gaia, a mysterious man with the talent to escape from most bonds is sent to a top security prision, only to meet a police investigator investigating this corrupt prison and then trying to escape...

2. *Moon Walker LTD. - Garimpeiro to Hikaru Ishi*

3. *Moon Walker LTD. - Tenkuu no Chiisana Yuusha*
trivia: Moon Walker LTD has at least three distinct arcs or storylines, including "Albatross no Shuujin," "Garimpeiro to Hikaru Ishi," and "Tenkuu no Chiisana Yuusha."
Moon Walker LTD - Albatross no Shuujin features a protagonist named Gaia, who possesses the ability to escape from bonds.
Moon Walker LTD - Albatross no Shuujin involves a corrupt prison and a police investigator.

title: Succeed
mu_description: The state of progress is one where one must look to the past in order to protect the future...but what must be done for the present? From legendary WSJ mangaka Osamu Akimoto comes a one-shot where memories are the key to understanding all: past, present and future...
trivia: Succeed is a one-shot manga, indicating it's a standalone story and not a serialized series.
Succeed is written by Osamu Akimoto, a mangaka known for other works in Weekly Shonen Jump.

title: Kintoki
mu_alt_titles: Kintoki: Toki of the Kinme Clan
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Once upon a time, the Kinme Clan was an extraordinary tribe best known for their incredible physical strength and golden eyes. Because of that, they were revered as gods of war, but now the clan is slowly dying out due to its short lifespan. And just when most everyone has forgotten about the clan, a mysterious golden-eyed boy enters the scene.

Published in Japan as part of the "Top of the Super Legends" series in Weekly Shounen Jump 2010 No. 50 issue. Published in English as "Kintoki: Toki of the Kinme Clan" by Viz Media in Weekly Shounen Jump 01/28/2013 digital issue and included in various digital Dragon Ball manga bundles.
trivia: Kintoki was originally published in Japan as part of the "Top of the Super Legends" series.
Kintoki features a protagonist descended from the Kinme Clan, known for their golden eyes and immense strength.
Kintoki was included in digital Dragon Ball manga bundles published by Viz Media.

title: Cyborg Roggy
mu_description:
Due to the spread of artificial biological implants known as "Augmentation Parts," people started to freely redesign their own bodies, and as a result, the world's law and order started to fall apart...

One day, a young man known as "Dog" receives a job to find this so-called "Hero" who has been getting rid of criminals lately. Who is this so-called Hero?! And what is he trying to do?!

Volume 1 includes the Shonen Jump version of the oneshot.  
Volume 2 includes the Jump VS version of the o e shot.
trivia: Cyborg Roggy involves a world where "Augmentation Parts" have destabilized law and order.
Cyborg Roggy features a protagonist nicknamed "Dog" tasked with finding a vigilante hero.
Cyborg Roggy has two different one-shot versions, a Shonen Jump version and a Jump VS version.

title: Enma Gavel
mu_description: Sousuke is the class president, and is a stickler for the rules. Lately, he's had lots of problems. First of all, he's got to deal with his cute, but unruly, childhood friend Miroku. Secondly, they have a new transfer student, Enma, who claims to be from hell. Enma refuses to follow any rules but his own. Lastly, there's the giant, mysterious claw marks that have been appearing all over school buildings. With all this trouble going on, will Sousuke follow the rules or learn that sometimes there are more important things?
trivia: Enma Gavel features a protagonist, Sousuke, who is the class president and initially a stickler for rules.
Enma Gavel includes a character named Enma who claims to be from hell and disregards rules.
Enma Gavel revolves around the mystery of giant claw marks appearing on school buildings.

title: Mon & Wed & Fri is Swimming
mu_alt_titles: Monday, Wednesday and Friday Is Swimming
mu_description:
Chiba Osamu and Arikawa Madoka are in the same middle school class and in the same swimming school on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. Although they have many opportunities to talk to each other, they never have for years now. They barely acknowledge each other, even though they have met hundreds of times. But when Osamu learns that Madoka is going to quit swimming school when she starts high school, something emotional starts to grow inside of Osamu. First, it began with nothing more than curiosity, but soon it blossomed into something more real. He has to tell Madoka what he is feeling before he never sees her again.

(Source: MangaHelpers)

title: Dois Sol
mu_description:
Nonaga Hiromasa is an up and coming soccer coach who has made a name for himself for bringing multiple teams from literally nothing to the top in the country. What’s even more impressive is that he just entered high school! He was recruited into his current high school as the new soccer coach, and his observation skills and ability to predict the opponents’ movement make his sole presence enough to win games.

The fact that Hiromasa is going to be coaching at the high school has many top soccer players flocking to this school, but none stand out more to him than Sakamichi Kappo. Not only can Kappo score a goal from half field with his powerful kick, but his ball control is second to none. Initially, Kappo didn’t want to play on a team because he thought no one understood “his soccer style,” but when Hiromasa was able to understand it, Kappo decideds to play for the team. Will the brilliant coach and the talented player be able to take the high school soccer world by storm?
trivia: Dois Sol features a high school soccer coach named Nonaga Hiromasa who is also a high school student.
Dois Sol highlights Sakamichi Kappo, a player whose powerful kick allows him to score from half-field.

title: ST&RS
mu_description:
On August 10 2019, humanity received a signal, which was verified for its integrity by hundreds of scientists, from an alien life form containing one message: let us meet on Mars on July 7, 2035. Thus began the creation of a space agency representing Earth as a whole named ST&RS. From there, things progressed quickly with man re-landing on the moon in 2022 and constructing many space stations orbiting Earth and the moon. The Space Academy was created to train the upcoming generation of ST&RS.  
On the same August 10th that Earth received the message, Shirafune Maho spoke his first words and it was “Mars.” Since then, Maho has been an astronomy freak who has nothing but the universe on his mind. He decides he is going to apply for the Space Academy along with his childhood friend, Hoshihara Meguru, and recent transfer and super smart classmate, Amachi Wataru. The trio begins their almost impossible journey of being accepted into the school where only 1% of the applicants are allowed into the academy.

The short story "Foo Fighter Fuji" from Vol 4 isn´t translated.
trivia: ST&RS features a protagonist, Shirafune Maho, whose first word was "Mars," foreshadowing his passion for space.
ST&RS involves a highly selective Space Academy, accepting only 1% of applicants.

title: Kagami no Kuni no Harisugawa
mu_description: High school student Akira Harisugawa has been in love with Mao Satomi, a girl in his grade, ever since grade school. The only problem? They've been best friends ever since Akira saved her from being hit by a car, and he doesn't want to ruin their friendship! That is until one day, when he finds a mysterious mirror...

title: Takamagahara
mu_description: Oneshot description: Inside of every human lie dormant superpowers. When these powers are awakened, some people use them for evil. Others use their power to stop those who commit evil deeds. One cruel boy named Hiruko has taken over his high school by using his superpowers. The students live in fear of him, until the day a mysterious transfer student, with his arm wrapped in a giant cast, arrives to stop him.
trivia: Takamagahara features a transfer student with a seemingly injured arm as the protagonist.
Takamagahara centers around individuals possessing awakened superpowers.
Takamagahara involves a high school setting terrorized by a student with superpowers.

title: Tsukimi no Soba
mu_description: I wanted to see you” are the words Kasugai Tenka wants to hear from a girl more than anything. And when the high school student hears it from Tsukimi, a girl literally out of this world, his life is about to get crazy. Tsukimi was a war general on the Moon, but she was exiled for the destruction she caused and her memory is wiped clean and she's changed into a bunny. She reminds Tenka that years ago, he fed her soba from his dad’s soba shop and that now that she's gained human form and her powers back, she wants him to be hers.
trivia: Tsukimi no Soba features a female protagonist who was formerly a war general exiled from the Moon.
Tsukimi no Soba centers around the wish of the male protagonist to hear a girl say "I wanted to see you."
Tsukimi no Soba involves a protagonist who feeds soba to a lunar rabbit who later transforms into a human.

title: Hungry Joker
mu_alt_titles: ハングリージョーカー
mu_description:
Follows the adventures of a scientist Haiji and his assistant Chitose. One day the doctor is called to resolve a mystery about a glowing corpse. From the will of an unknown power the corpse then transforms into a monster and Haiji has to defeat it, to learn all about a mysterious black apple which can regenerate itself and which when eaten will enable someone to control gravity...

Winner of 2011 Golden Future Cup. (Oneshot)
trivia: Hungry Joker won the 2011 Golden Future Cup as a one-shot manga.
Hungry Joker features a scientist named Haiji who seeks to control gravity.
Hungry Joker involves a black apple that grants the power to control gravity when eaten.

title: Straighten Up! Welcome to Shika High's Competitive Dance Club
mu_title: Sesuji wo Pin! to - Shikakou Kyougi Dance-bu e Youkoso
mu_alt_titles: Sesuji o Pin! to - Shikakou Kyougi Dance-bu e Youkoso
Straighten Up! Welcome to Shika High's Competitive Dance Club
背すじをピン!と ～鹿高競技ダンス部へようこそ～
mu_description:
Masaharu Tsuchiya is as dorky as they get and is determined to make high school different from middle school. But can he keep his inherent awkwardness from ruining his first day? Furthermore, what club will he join? Surely not something like... dance club?

Included one-shot:  
Volume 10: Kyougi Dance-bu e Youkoso

Note: Won the DaVinchi x NicoNico Tsugi 2016 Manga Awards.
trivia: Straighten Up! Welcome to Shika High's Competitive Dance Club features a protagonist named Masaharu Tsuchiya who aims to reinvent himself in high school.
Straighten Up! Welcome to Shika High's Competitive Dance Club won the DaVinchi x NicoNico Tsugi 2016 Manga Awards.
Straighten Up! Welcome to Shika High's Competitive Dance Club includes a one-shot titled "Kyougi Dance-bu e Youkoso" in Volume 10.

title: Nisekoi
mu_alt_titles: รักลวงป่วนใจ
mu_description:
From Viz:  
It’s hate at first sight or rather a knee to the head at first sight when Raku Ichijo meets Chitoge Kirisaki! Unfortunately, Raku’s gangster father arranges a false love match between Raku and their rival gang leader’s daughter, who just so happens to be Chitoge! Raku’s searching for his childhood sweetheart from ten years ago, however, with a pendant around his neck as a memento but he can't even remember the girl’s name or face.

[Read for FREE on Manga Plus](https://mangaplus.shueisha.co.jp/titles/100019)
categories: Female Lead Falls in Love First
Love Interests Who Don't Get Along
trivia: Nisekoi features a protagonist, Raku Ichijo, who is the son of a Yakuza boss.
Nisekoi revolves around a fake relationship between Raku and Chitoge.
Nisekoi involves Raku searching for his childhood sweetheart.

title: Koisome Momiji
mu_description:
Oneshot:

There is a saying that if you find a Japanese maple leaf with eight tips you will find everlasting love. A popular high school actress is now making a film about that legend at the main character's high school, who in turn has a crush on her. One day after school he runs into her and helps her escape from some pursuing staff members. It turns out that since she started acting right after middle school she hasn't had any experience with love and that is hurting the production of the movie. So to get some experience with love she invites him out on a date.

Included the following stories:

Volume 1: Koisome Momiji (Pilot)

Volume 2: *FamiDol!*  
Daichi's, a teenage boy with little experience with women, life takes an unexpected turn of events.  
After his mother's remarriage, he obtains a new sister, who is no other than the famous idol Asano Nanami.  
What is Daichi going to do when they end up alone together and Nanami wants nothing to do with him?
trivia: Koisome Momiji features a plot device centered around the legend of an eight-tipped Japanese maple leaf symbolizing everlasting love.
Koisome Momiji includes a second story titled *FamiDol!* about a boy gaining a famous idol as a stepsister.

title: Pajama na Kanojo.
mu_description:
From [Pinoymanga Scans](https://www.mangaupdates.com/groups.html?id=39355688842):  
Keisuke and Makura are childhood friends who grew up together almost like brother and sister. One day, due to a misunderstanding they had, Makura left the house angry until Keisuke's Mom is worried about Makura not coming home yet, thus Keisuke is told to go look for her.  
Reluctantly, Keisuke went out to find Makura, He ended up at a place they used to go often, the sunflower field. Luckily, Makura was there. Keisuke joined her sitting on the bench and they began to reminiscence.  
When Keisuke decided that they should head back home, her mother phoned him and said that Makura collapsed and didn't wake up. She also told him to head to the hospital immediately. At that same moment, he looked at Makura, who was not standing but floating in the air.
categories: Female Lead Falls in Love First
trivia: Pajama na Kanojo. features a protagonist named Keisuke who searches for his childhood friend, Makura.
Pajama na Kanojo. involves a plot point where Makura is reported to have collapsed despite being physically present.
Pajama na Kanojo. begins with Keisuke and Makura reminiscing in a sunflower field.

title: Koisuru Edison
mu_description:
From [K.I.S.S.](http://www.mangaupdates.com/groups.html?id=4602):

It's said that Thomas Edison stuffed all of his knowledge into his final invention, a screw. Presently, said screw is buried inside the head of Matsunaka Spica, a high-school girl!!! When Matsunaka Spica's thoughts rise to a high enough level, she can create amazing inventions that would normally be impossible to construct!
trivia: Koisuru Edison features a high school girl who can create inventions based on her thought level.

title: Double Bullet
mu_description: Meet the city of absolute public order, Astraea. In it, the elite make sure there is a 99% yearly arrest rating, so it's no wonder it is often called the City of Justice. However for the remaining 1% there's Double Bullet, the team made up of 3 "lower ranked" individuals Kanako, Tamaru, and Barret.

title: Cross Manage
mu_description: "Hard working" or "passionate" was not in Sakurai's vocabulary and joining a team sports in school was out of the question. But one day, he accidentally walks in on his female classmate Toyoguchi naked in the locker room and in return for keeping it a secret from everyone else, he is forced to become the manager for the female lacrosse team. Toyoguchi is passionate about lacrosse and was responsible for creating the team for the school. Sakurai reluctantly begins his role as manager but is slowly drawn into Toyoguchi's personality and begins researching and enjoying the sport. The once lazy Sakurai who was scared of failure now learns to put himself out there and put serious effort into something worthwhile.
trivia: Cross Manage centers around Sakurai, a reluctant manager of a newly formed all-girls lacrosse team.
Cross Manage features Toyoguchi, the passionate founder of the school's female lacrosse team.
Cross Manage sees Sakurai transform from a lazy individual to someone who embraces hard work and dedication.

title: Sensei no Baruji
mu_alt_titles: บัลจ์ The Star Warrior (Thai)
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Spunky slum kid Astro gets the chance of a lifetime to end the chaos ripping apart his home planet when the playboy prince switches places with him. Now Astro has become Prince Barrage, a boy charged with the duty of restoring peace to the planet and given an all-powerful magical spear to do it.  
In order to save the planet, Astro will have to battle terrifying aliens while learning how to fight from his even more frightening guardian, the exacting knight Tiamat. Does a kid like Astro have what it takes to become the real prince and save the planet?
trivia: Sensei no Baruji features a protagonist named Astro who assumes the identity of Prince Barrage.
Sensei no Baruji involves Astro receiving a magical spear to help restore peace.
Sensei no Baruji sees Astro being trained by the knight Tiamat.

title: Koganeiro
mu_description: "Koganeiro" is about a group of high schoolers in their second year who are confronted with the possibly life-altering decision of what to do after high school.

title: Assassination Classroom
mu_description:
The story is about class 3-E of Kunugigaoka Middle School, where every morning they greet their teacher with a massive firing squad. The teacher is a weird combination of an alien and a octopus that moves at speeds of mach-20. It turns out this creature was responsible for the destruction of the moon, rendering it forever in a crescent shape. He has announced that he will destroy the world in one year. The creature will teach class 3-E how to assassinate him before the year is over.

Volume 21 contains Tokyo Depato Sensou Taikenki (Tokyo Department War Memoir).

[Read for FREE on Manga Plus](https://mangaplus.shueisha.co.jp/titles/100001)
trivia: Assassination Classroom features an octopus-like teacher capable of moving at Mach 20.

title: Goblin Night
mu_description: Six years ago, the phenomenon known as "Goblin Night" gave 1 out of every 100 people the ability to transform into a monster, which came to be called a "goblin." As neither the government nor the police could oppose or keep up with them, some goblins committed evil acts with their power and caused society to crumble. In present-day Japan, Mamoru and Yuki, who possess the "goblin" ability, strive to protect their town - though the events that took place on Goblin Night, which resulted in the death of his brother, left Mamoru disinclined to trust or care about other people. And things only get worse when his brother's killer comes to town...
trivia: Goblin Night resulted in 1% of the population gaining the ability to transform into goblins.
Goblin Night caused significant societal disruption due to the unchecked power of newly formed goblins.
Goblin Night is the origin of Mamoru's distrust of others, stemming from his brother's death.

title: After School ☆ Idol
mu_description: High School Student Kiriyama Kyotarou's parents own a beauty shop that he helps in everyday after school. Due to the fact he has to go home to work everyday after school, he never has the chance to get a girlfriend or join any clubs. But that may change since the delinquent female gang-head of his school asked him to teach her how to be an idol.

title: Shinmai Fukei Kiruko-san
mu_description: Meet the tiny police station of rejects, consisting of Kanjuurou the snide chief, Haruki the common pervert patrol officer, and Kiruko, the rookie policewoman… who also just happens to be an insanely strong former military mercenary!

title: Food Wars: Shokugeki no Soma
mu_alt_titles: ยอดนักปรุงโซมะ
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Soma Yukihira's old man runs a small family restaurant in the less savory end of town. Aiming to one day surpass his father's culinary prowess, Soma hones his skills day in and day out until one day, out of the blue, his father decides to enroll Soma in a classy culinary school! Can Soma really cut it in a school that prides itself on a 10 percent graduation rate? And can he convince the beautiful, domineering heiress of the school that he belongs there at all?


[Official English](https://mangaplus.shueisha.co.jp/titles/100013)
categories: Female Lead Falls in Love First
trivia: Food Wars: Shokugeki no Soma follows Soma Yukihira's journey from a small family restaurant to a prestigious culinary school.
Food Wars: Shokugeki no Soma features a culinary school with a remarkably low 10% graduation rate.
Food Wars: Shokugeki no Soma centers around Soma Yukihira's ambition to surpass his father's cooking skills.

title: Kurokuroku
mu_description: Yusa Chiaki is an ordinary high school student, whose motto is simplicity and frugality. Her favorite character is Uesugi Youzan. One day, while searching for a part-time job, she gets chased by kappas and a mysterious man rescues her. What will happen to her now?

title: World Trigger
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Earth is under constant threat from Neighbors, invincible monsters from another dimension that destroy our way of life. At least we have the elite warriors of Border, who co-opt alien technology to fight back.  
Our hero Osamu Mikumo may not be the best agent, but he’ll do whatever it takes to defend life on Earth as we know it. When Osamu meets a feisty humanoid Neighbor named Yuma, everything that he thinks is right is turned on its head. Can the two natural enemies ever become friends?

[Read for FREE on MANGA Plus](https://mangaplus.shueisha.co.jp/titles/100028)
trivia: World Trigger focuses on the organization Border, which utilizes alien technology to defend Earth.
World Trigger features Neighbors, monsters from another dimension that pose a threat to Earth.

title: Sporting Salt
mu_alt_titles: スポーツティングソルト
mu_description: Shioya really likes to help sportsmen, to the point that he is weirdly fascinated by them. He has a dream of becoming best sports doctor in the world, and he is already quite good at it even though he is still in high school.

title: Brand New School Day
mu_description: Shinjou wants to enter high school as a new man, since he had not been very popular back in Middle School.  As he's trying to edge his way into society with his new look and personality, he happens to bump into Kurai Kako, a classmate from Middle School who had been just as invisible as he was.  With her new look and personality, has arrived for just the same reason he has, and she's looking forward to snagging a boyfriend for high school.  They'll just have to make a bet -- who'll get a boyfriend/girlfriend first?

title: Smoky B.B.
mu_description:
Enjiro is a talented baseball player, but has to quit due to a 100 million yen debt. Komado's family runs Benten High School, but the school is on the brink on bankruptcy and (for some strange reason) the only way to save it, is to win the National High School Baseball Tournament (a.k.a the Koshien Tournament).  
Seeing Enjiro as their savior, Komado offers to pay him 100 million yen, if he joins the school's baseball team and wins the Koshien Tournament.

title: Ginga Patrol Jaco
mu_alt_titles: JACO - TUẦN TRA VIÊN DẢI NGÂN HÀ
ドラゴンボール マイナス
銀河パトロール ジャコ
mu_description: Note: Included is a special/bonus story called *Dragon Ball − (Minus)*.
trivia: Ginga Patrol Jaco features a bonus story, *Dragon Ball − (Minus)*, offering backstory related to Goku's origins.
Ginga Patrol Jaco is a manga series serialized in Shonen Jump.
Ginga Patrol Jaco is related to Akira Toriyama's popular *Dragon Ball* franchise.

title: Jaco the Galactic Patrolman
mu_alt_titles: JACO - TUẦN TRA VIÊN DẢI NGÂN HÀ
ドラゴンボール マイナス
銀河パトロール ジャコ
mu_description: Note: Included is a special/bonus story called *Dragon Ball − (Minus)*.
trivia: Jaco the Galactic Patrolman is a prequel to Akira Toriyama's more famous work, Dragon Ball.
Jaco the Galactic Patrolman includes a bonus chapter called "Dragon Ball − (Minus)" which retells the origins of Goku.
Jaco the Galactic Patrolman features characters and elements that connect to the Dragon Ball universe, like Bulma's older sister, Tights.

title: Hime-dol!!
mu_description: Inspired by his grandfather's skills, Kiriyama Kyoutarou's dream is to become a hairstylist. For that he enrolls in Yumemino Private Academy, also known as Tech High, the first combined technical high school in the country, more specifically he enrolls in the Beautician Department. Little did he know that his neighbor in class is Samejima Alto, an infamous female delinquent renowned for her monstrous strength. Even after that meeting his school life proves to be quite eventful as he stumbles upon a mysterious idol's secretive practice, discovers a connection with the biggest up-and-coming idol around and receives a rather unexpected request from the fearful Samejima - "Can you turn me into an idol!?". A story about following your dreams, even when everything and everyone seems to believe they're unfit considering who you are.
trivia: Hime-dol!! features a protagonist aspiring to be a hairstylist, Kiriyama Kyoutarou.
Hime-dol!! centers around the unlikely pairing of a hairstylist student and a female delinquent who wants to become an idol.

title: Hachi: Tokyo 23-Ku
mu_description:
From Dan of Population GO:

"Mutants have popped up in Tokyo. These mutants are the relatives of gods and upon consuming human blood they transform into their awakened state which resembles the god that they are related to. Hachi has a nose as good as any dog's. After his best friend is attacked by a mutant he drinks her blood in order to save her."
trivia: Hachi: Tokyo 23-Ku features mutants who are descendants of gods.
Hachi: Tokyo 23-Ku is created by the mangaka known as Dan of Population GO.

title: 31 Heroes
mu_alt_titles: サーティーワンヒーローズ
mu_description:
Rokurou, the class' cockroach (figuratively speaking), is visited at night by an alien girl who bestows magical powers upon him!  
Finally, he can ascend from his status of a complete nobody to the town's unique super hero! … Right?

title: Drump
mu_description:
From [MangaHelpers](https://www.mangaupdates.com/groups.html?id=48756242591);

One day, Bianca, Rosso and Nero visit the site where a dragon presumably was defeated at the Dragon Hill Ruins based on a map. Upon closer inspection of the map, Bianca notices a mysterious spade symbol and the word "DRUMP" written across the map. They find where the spade symbol is located, dig in its spot and find a mysterious object that causes a change in Rosso. What is the object, what connection does it have to dragons and what does DRUMP even mean?! [c_k]
trivia: Drump likely involves dragons due to its setting at the Dragon Hill Ruins.

title: Iron Knight
mu_description: Tsubasa Teppei, a young boy, wakes up in the middle of the street to discover that the world has gone to hell, with no memories after he had gone to school earlier that day. A strange epidemic appeared that transformed many humans into mindless monsters called Goblins. Some of these Goblins have retained their human minds, but not their human morality. It seems that Teppei may not necessarily be normal either. Does he have what it takes to protect the people that he cares about?
categories: Female Lead Falls in Love First

title: Mitsukubi Condor
mu_description: Many years ago, an evil witch ruled the continent, and she had many magical treasures. Now the land is ruled by a king, but the witch's treasures remain. A young amateur thief named Sue is determined to sneak into the nearby ruins and steal treasure to help her poor village. On her way, she runs into one of the 3 legendary thieves, Marshmellow, who is obsessed with beauty. He isn't quite as suave as she'd expected, but he seems to have the same eyes as the ancient witch. After their first adventure together, Sue joins him on his journey to collect all the witch's treasures. He claims he is only interested in their beauty, but what will happen if he actually recovers them all?

title: Gazer
mu_description: Frustrated that no one believes her, in order to capture a serial killer, a mind-reading detective teams up with the head of the "occult division"... who's a lot younger than she thought.

title: E-Robot
mu_description: Yuuki's got the hots for Shirahama. All he's got to do is confess his undying love for her. The only problem is, he just can't do it! Every time he tries to tell her how he feels, he ends up chickening out. His life then completely changes when he runs into a robotic beauty named Ai Roborovskii. She's earth's first Erotic Robot, and her sexy "features" aren't just for show. She was created to save the world with her incredible erotic powers!
trivia: E-Robot features a protagonist named Yuuki who struggles to confess his love for Shirahama.

title: Illegal Rare
mu_description:
From [MangaHelpers](http://www.mangaupdates.com/groups.html?id=1011):

Supernatural creatures live alongside humans, but these "rares" are being hunted to extinction over time. An organization is being formed to protect these rares, and allow them to live their lives as they like. The starting members of this organization are few; there's the masked Fukumen, the Black Vampyr king AxL, and they are soon joined by the sweet-voiced mermaid Mirror. Together, they will protect the rares from the deadly hunters! [tethysdust]
categories: Character/s Who Are Bad at Waking Up

title: Stealth Symphony
mu_alt_titles: ステルス交境曲〈シンフォニー〉
mu_description: In a world where elves, dwarves, and invisible dragons live in harmony inside a metropolitan city, Jig sets out to find someone or something that can unleash the curse that he carries on his back. As he attempts to survive in the city of Jinbocho, a city filled with fantastic secrets and organizations, he encounters many powerful individuals who set out to either destroy him or save him. Will Jig be able to discover the true secret of his curse, or will it lead him to his own demise?

title: Tokyo Wonder Boys
mu_alt_titles: TOKYO WONDER BOYS トーキョー ワンダー ボーイズ
トーキョー ワンダー ボーイズ
mu_description:
From [MangaHelpers](https://www.mangaupdates.com/groups.html?id=1011):

Hinomoto Kyuji is currently the biggest name in Japan's high school soccer league. Everyone expected him to go pro in the Japanese league, but he believes that staying in Japan would be a waste and thinks he needs to go abroad and enter the European league. Then, he meets Nanjo Ichimaru, another high schooler who eerily resembles Hinomoto's childhood favorite soccer player. Both Nanjo and Hinomoto get pulled into the SA Nishigaoka Japan league team, a weak and struggling team that has seen better days. Will these two be able to lead the team to victory? [DrCoke]
trivia: Tokyo Wonder Boys focuses on high school soccer players Hinomoto Kyuji and Nanjo Ichimaru.
Tokyo Wonder Boys features the struggling SA Nishigaoka Japan league team.
Tokyo Wonder Boys involves Hinomoto's ambition to play in the European league.

title: Peach Pluck
mu_description:
From Dan of Population GO:  
An island was recently discovered off the coast of Japan. This island was mysteriously full of young men and women who lived as though they were in medieval Japan. The Japanese government immediately went to work enrolling them into modern Japanese schools. But not all is as it seems with these islanders. Could they all be descendents of the yokai expelled by the fabled Momotarou? Nahh, couldn't be.
trivia: Peach Pluck involves islanders who may be descendants of yokai defeated by Momotarou.
Peach Pluck features a premise where people from a newly discovered island are integrated into modern Japanese schools.
Peach Pluck is a manga series created by Dan of Population GO.

title: Abare Mashira
mu_alt_titles: ウルトラ・バトル・サテライト
mu_description:
Welcome to the world of street fighting!!  
Sakura Momochi, a mysterious black-haired girl appears before teenage fighter, Jin Matsuriya.

"You'll get one soon… an invitation to real deadly fights with no rules... a tournament where blood is washed away with blood."

Her mysterious words and an invitation arriving at the same time to the UBS (Ultra Battle Satellite) fighting tournament draws Jin into the world of street fighting!!

A no rule head-on battle begins!!
trivia: Abare Mashira features Jin Matsuriya as the protagonist, a teenage fighter drawn into a dangerous tournament.
Abare Mashira involves the UBS (Ultra Battle Satellite) fighting tournament, characterized by having no rules.

title: Kamidori
mu_description: The peerless chivalrous thief is finally caught!! The poor Goemon will be boiled in a pot!? The oneshot about the great thief who doesn't even fear the gods.

title: Hi-Fi Cluster
mu_alt_titles: Hi-Fi CLUSTER-六攻特課事件実例-
mu_description:
In the future, people no longer have to be especially skilled at anything. If somebody wants to know how to drive a car, they just download the driving App into a special label that gets placed on their body. But in this Ability Society, there is a poor teenager named Heita who is unable to synchronize with the labels and therefore has no place in society.

One day, Heita finds himself involved with the smuggling of a special label that just happens to synchronize with him and him alone. Suddenly, a man in a black suit named Kandera arrests Heita for the possession of an illegal label. When Kandera notices that the label has synchronized with Heita, he makes a deal with him. If Heita works with Kandera in the special police task force finding more special labels, Heita's crime will be forgiven. Now Heita has to work together with the strange people working in the special police task force and try to remove illegal labels from the streets.
trivia: Hi-Fi Cluster features a protagonist named Heita who is initially unable to use standard skill-enhancing labels.
Hi-Fi Cluster centers around the conflict between an "Ability Society" and illegal labels that grant unique powers.
Hi-Fi Cluster involves a special police task force dedicated to recovering and managing these special labels.

title: Shikigami Twilight Days
mu_description: A serial killer is on the loose and authorities are baffled! What they do not know is that this case requires non-traditional research methods. That's where Mako Miyoshi the detective and Kyosuke Kagami the Shikigami user enter the picture. Together they investigate supernatural crimes!

title: My Hero Academia
mu_alt_titles: มายฮีโร่ อคาเดเมีย
มายฮีโร่อคาเดเมีย
僕のヒーローアカデミア
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Middle school student Izuku Midoriya wants to be a hero more than anything, but he hasn’t got an ounce of power in him. With no chance of ever getting into the prestigious U.A. High School for budding heroes, his life is looking more and more like a dead end. Then an encounter with All Might, the greatest hero of them all, gives him a chance to change his destiny. 

**Official English:** [MANGA Plus](https://mangaplus.shueisha.co.jp/titles/100017) | [Viz (Shonen Jump)](https://www.viz.com/my-hero-academia)

Note: Won the 1st Next Manga Award in 2015, the Mandō Kobayashi Manga Award in 2015, the Japan Expo Awards in 2017 and 2018, the 3rd Sugoi Japan Award in 2017, the 23rd and 24th Salón del Manga de Barcelona in 2017 and 2018 and the 31st Harvey Awards in 2019.  
Nominated for the 8th Manga Taisho Award in 2015, the 40th Kodansha Manga Award in 2016, the 44th and 47th Angoulême International Comics Festival in 2017 and 2020 and the 30th Harvey Awards for Best Manga in 2018.
categories: Female Lead Falls in Love First
trivia: My Hero Academia won the 1st Next Manga Award in 2015.
My Hero Academia is published in English by Viz through Shonen Jump.
My Hero Academia features a protagonist named Izuku Midoriya who initially has no superpowers.

title: Yoakemono
mu_description:
From [MangaHelpers](https://www.mangaupdates.com/groups.html?id=1011):  
The two boys Gin and Jinrou form a tough team in the mountains. One day, Gin decides that the only way they can move forward is to travel to the capital and join the Shinsengumi.   
It soon becomes clear, though, that they are not tough enough to handle the kind of people they find in the capital. Some of them, including the current Shinsengumi members, smell like beasts to Jinrou, and they seem to have unusual abilities. After Gin's tragic death, Jinrou is determined to become stronger and join the Shinsengumi in his place.
trivia: Yoakemono features a protagonist named Jinrou who possesses the ability to detect "beastly" individuals.
Yoakemono begins with the death of a character named Gin, which motivates Jinrou's actions.

title: Devily Man
mu_description:
Madogiwa is an all-time bottom rank employee of a demon trading company that lends their powers to humans.    
His client in the human world turns out to be…a little young boy?!   
The strange duo goes off to rake in the money!!

(Source: shonenjump.com)

title: Aru Asa Okitara
mu_description:
Oneshot from NisiOisin and Kawada Yuuya:

A boy suddenly wakes up to find out he's in the body of a high School girl. Who is she and how did he switch bodies?
trivia: Aru Asa Okitara is a oneshot manga written by NisiOisin.
Aru Asa Okitara is illustrated by Kawada Yuuya.
Aru Asa Okitara features a body swap plot involving a boy waking up in a high school girl's body.

title: Henshin Ganbou!
mu_description:
A oneshot by NisiOisin and Miyokawa Masaru:

Sunaki is a back-up player on the baseball team. One day, he finally gets the courage to put a love letter into the school idol's shoe locker, but where will his actions take him?

(The title is a play on words: 変身願望! (Henshin Ganbou!), or Desire for Change!, vs 返信願望! (Henshin Ganbou!), or Desire for a Reply!)
categories: Character Who Bullies the One They Love
Female Lead Falls in Love First
trivia: Henshin Ganbou! is a one-shot manga, not a serialized series.
Henshin Ganbou! is written by NisiOisin, known for the Monogatari series.
Henshin Ganbou! The title plays on the similar pronunciation but different meanings of "desire for change" and "desire for a reply."

title: Judos
mu_description: The emergence of a mysterious young judoka, Yanagi Hana, who defeated world class judoka Ida Keiji, will be taking part in the Judos fest in Yahara Village, the mysterious village of Judo he comes from.

title: Tiger Dragon Brothers
mu_alt_titles: タイガー兄とドラゴン

That's where Mako Miyoshi the detective and Kyosuke Kagami the Shikigami user enter the picture. Together they investigate supernatural crimes!

title: Black Clover

From Viz:  
Young Asta was born with no magic ability in a world where magic is everything. In order to prove his strength and keep a promise with his friend, Asta dreams of becoming the greatest mage in the land, the Wizard King.

[Read for FREE on Manga Plus](https://mangaplus.shueisha.co.jp/titles/100003)

title: Lady Justice
mu_alt_titles: レディ・ジャスティス
mu_description: Marufuji Enta has a crush on Kenzaki Ameri and as they visit the same class for the first time the best day of his life starts! Ironically, he gets kidnapped until a mysterious hooded girl appears in front of the gangster's car in the name of justice.

title: Shokugeki no Soma
mu_alt_titles: ยอดนักปรุงโซมะ
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Soma Yukihira's old man runs a small family restaurant in the less savory end of town. Aiming to one day surpass his father's culinary prowess, Soma hones his skills day in and day out until one day, out of the blue, his father decides to enroll Soma in a classy culinary school! Can Soma really cut it in a school that prides itself on a 10 percent graduation rate? And can he convince the beautiful, domineering heiress of the school that he belongs there at all?


[Official English](https://mangaplus.shueisha.co.jp/titles/100013)

title: Boruto

ناروتو جايدن: الطريق المضاء بالقمر المكتمل
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Years have passed since Naruto and Sasuke teamed up to defeat Kaguya, the progenitor of chakra and the greatest threat the ninja world has ever faced. Times are now peaceful and the new generation of shinobi has not experienced the same hardships as its parents. Perhaps that is why Boruto would rather play video games than train. However, one passion does burn deep in this ninja boy’s heart and that is the desire to defeat his father.

[Read for FREE on Manga Plus](https://mangaplus.shueisha.co.jp/titles/100006)

title: Best Blue
mu_description: Takumi Aono really wants to be a competitive swimmer! Like, really, really, really wants to be one. Although he swims everyday, rain or shine, he's still not there yet. But when he meets a very bitter lifeguard, something unexpected happens!

title: Galaxy Gangs
mu_alt_titles: ギャラクシーギャングス
mu_description: In the Milky Way galaxy there are many gangs vying for control of the galaxy. Our protagonists Sora Hidaka (Earth born) and Fendy Ecapipo (Mars born) of the Vacca Gang are sent out to investigate a monolith mine that is reported to be run by a "hustler" who is exporting weapons made using the monoliths just outside of Vacca Gang territory in neutral space.

title: Samon-kun wa Summoner
mu_description:
Class-president Sakura Teshigawara tries to get the new transfer student Shosuke Samon to join a club or found his own as he is always alone in class. He got off the wrong foot with the class after claiming that his favorite Hobby was "summoning Demons".  
Samon becomes interested in her after he learns of her being a "good person" including her image as an Angel. So he invites her to the roof to talk about something. Thinking he is about to confess his love she gets excited at first, until he tells her that he hates her because she is such a busy-body and a goody-two-shoes. That would be the end of it, if not for a small detail: Samon can actually summon Demons and decides to get her to show her true colors by saddling her with Demons to tempt her into acting slothful or gluttonous for example. Watching greedy people getting corrupted by demons is a favorite past-time of his after all. As the Demon world is pissed at Samon because  he summons Demons so often, Assassins are sent after him and his perceived associates.   
He defends Teshigawara from one such attack, because he wants to witness her downfall and a violent death is too boring.
trivia: Samon-kun wa Summoner features a protagonist, Samon, who actively summons demons, despite the demon world's displeasure.
Samon-kun wa Summoner revolves around Samon's desire to corrupt the "good person" Sakura Teshigawara by tempting her with demons.
Samon-kun wa Summoner involves assassins from the demon world being sent after Samon and those associated with him.

title: Buddy Strike
mu_description: It is said that there is a legendary catcher who can turn any pitcher he forms a battery with into a star. But this catcher requires something in return—the pitcher's soul. That is why the catcher is also known as the Grim Reaper. The pitcher will throw his soul into each pitch until that pitcher dies. But for down-on-his-luck pitcher Ryo Arakami, this may be the deal he was looking for after all!

title: Shimatsuya K
mu_description: In a town, there lives a legend of a phantasmic god of death. He protects the townspeople from all evil criminals but not a single soul knows what he looks like. His name is K. A boy searches for him and tries to discovers his identity.

title: Cremators
mu_description: In the world, there are some evil creatures known as "chousha" (the kanji read "Chou" = "Omen" and "Sha" = "person") that can only be killed by Cremators, people who use fire to incinerate them.

title: Vanguard of Archer
mu_description:
After 10 years of training, Yoichi returns home to fight against the Wenkamui, an endless horde of mysterious monsters that threaten the safety of his village. He's not alone in his fight; his best friend Ryuu, drawer of the divine sword Kamui, has also spent this time training to fulfill his destiny. However, a decade is a long time, and upon his return, not everything is as Yoichi expected it would be...

[Written by MAL Rewrite]

title: Kimetsu no Yaiba
mu_alt_titles: Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba (English, Italian)

title: The Promised Neverland
mu_alt_titles: พันธสัญญาเนเวอร์แลนด์ (SIC)
mu_description:
From Viz:  
Emma, Norman and Ray are the brightest kids at the Grace Field House orphanage. And under the care of the woman they refer to as “Mom,” all the kids have enjoyed a comfortable life. Good food, clean clothes and the perfect environment to learn - what more could an orphan ask for? One day, though, Emma and Norman uncover the dark truth of the outside world they are forbidden from seeing.

title: Love Rush!
mu_description:
Reiji Hakuba has a genetic condition that makes girls go crazy for him. It's called the Ubermale Gene, and whoever has it appears like the hottest guy ever to all the girls he meets. This may sound like a dream come true, but too much of something you love can become a nightmare. And things really get complicated when non-human girls start chasing him around. Specifically, a Cupid Princess from the Divine Realm!

(Source: VIZ Media)
trivia: Love Rush! centers around a protagonist, Reiji Hakuba, who possesses the "Ubermale Gene."

title: Red Sprite
mu_description:
Technology has advanced due to the discovery of an alternative source of fuel called "Thunder-Cores." This has changed civilization for the better due to the creation of longer lasting trains and cars, and a new form of transportation called Air-Ships!

The story follows Tatsu Frampt, a young boy who lives in an orphanage nowhere near the city, who dreams that one day he will be the captain of his own air-ship and travel around the world alongside his friends. He is told that he and his friends are being isolated from civilization due to a disease that makes iron grow in their bodies. However, the orphanage is attacked, and Tatsu is the sole survivor, and learns the dark truth of his "disease." Six years later, he embarks on a mission to save his friends, and kill those who stand in his way...
trivia: Red Sprite features "Thunder-Cores" as an alternative fuel source powering its advanced technology.
Red Sprite involves air-ships as a prominent mode of transportation in its world.

title: Ibitsu no Amalgam
mu_description: This story is about a boy named Rokumichi Kusaba who wants to confess his feelings to Yayoi Hino, his childhood friend. Unfortunately, after choosing the place to confess, he gets crushed by a train and loses his lower half. Rokumichi then gets saved by a scientist who turns him into a monster instead of a regular human being. What is his life going to be like while being under the guise of a monster? And what will his childhood friend think?!
trivia: Ibitsu no Amalgam centers around a protagonist transformed into a monster after a horrific accident.

trivia: Spring Weapon Number One focuses on the conflict between MAPPO and the Numbers.

title: Haru Yo, Koi!
mu_description: Kumoro Tsuyoshi is in his third year in middle school, and is in the midst of studying for his entrance exams. He wants to go to the same school as his childhood friend, Kamijou Haru, who's two years his senior, since she's his crush. Will he succeed?

title: Golem Hearts
mu_description:
In the world of Golem Hearts, creatures known as golems have become integrated with society, performing all sorts of tasks. These golems are created by the widely-respected "sorcery scholars," and obey the commands of their human masters without question. Noah is a sorcery scholar who strives to become the second best of his kind.

To that end, he travels far and wide to study unique golems around the world. This journey leads him to a certain island, where he encounters a girl named Mary and her golem Murray. As the two get acquainted, we begin to discover that there may be more to Noah than meets the eye.
trivia: Golem Hearts features golems that are created by "sorcery scholars" and are generally obedient to their human masters.
Golem Hearts follows the journey of Noah, a sorcery scholar aiming to be the second-best of his kind.

title: U19
mu_description:
Year 2036, Japan is under the adult party power and make children's life miserable. But for "rebelious-edgy-teenager-with-funny-scar" Kudo Eiji, It doesn't matter because he has his childhood friend Akari to cheer his everyday life. For Eiji, Akari is his emontional mainstay. Someone that can make him calm.  
But then, one day adult party decide took Akari and transfer her to another school. It emotionaly stress Eiji out. Little did Eiji know, this awaken some power inside him
trivia: U19 is set in Japan in the year 2036, where an adult party holds significant power.
U19 features a protagonist, Kudo Eiji, who has a "funny scar."

title: Poro no Ryugaku-ki
mu_description: The manga centers on Poro, a demon from the underworld who comes to the human world.

title: Harapeko no Marie
mu_description:
A legend says that the ghost of a girl stands on the top of an old Catholic church, inhabited by the Sagimiya family. Said family has a hateful rivalry with the Bijogi family, who manage a Taoist temple next door. In the middle of all this, Bijogi Taiga has had a crush on Sagimiya Anna, the demure daughter of the priest, since childhood.

Little did he know, the Sagimiya are involved in very un-Catholic activities such as trying to resurrect the spirit of Marie-Thérèse Charlotte, the food-obsessed daughter of the late French queen Marie Antoinette. And since he has found out, he will have to "collaborate" − i.e. be the human sacrifice to that end. Nevertheless, just before the "ritual," Taiga decides to confess his love to Anna and is struck by a lightning bolt the second after. He miraculously survives without a scratch, but somehow finds himself in a body slightly more... blonde and feminine.
categories: Male Lead Falls in Love First
trivia: Harapeko no Marie features a protagonist, Bijogi Taiga, who transforms into a body resembling Marie Antoinette.
Harapeko no Marie involves a rivalry between the Sagimiya family, associated with a Catholic church, and the Bijogi family, associated with a Taoist temple.

title: Dr. Stone

One fateful day, all of humanity was petrified by a blinding flash of light. After several millennia, high schooler Taiju awakens and finds himself lost in a world of statues. However, he’s not alone! His science-loving friend Senku’s been up and running for a few months and he's got a grand plan in mind - to kickstart civilization with the power of science.
